title: Brilliant wedding reception
comment: Our son and his bride had their wedding reception there ,literally the day the covid restrictions were lifted.So everything was last minute with constant changes. We were on the roof terrace, all safely socially distanced in the open air yet covered by a very large type of parasol.It was ideal. There is an open fire so you can stay warm without noisy or obtrusive heaters.  The food was great and the service outstanding. The roof terrace is totally private from the rest of the pub and is ideal for wedding receptions, work parties , or just a private party.I n the covid era with all its guidelines, a safe yet surprisingly cosy ambience. All this with the most positive and helpful landlord you could hope for , and it didnt break the bank either.

title: Good food, Awful staff
comment: Booked the day before to go for a Sunday roast as they are rated as one of the best. Location and interior all lovely.  The roast was great, really well cooked and portion size was great. I would recommend the beef if it’s on.  The biggest issue we had was the staff, they were just rude. Seemed like we were a inconvenience to be there. The bar staff were the worst, it really felt as though we were not worthy of there time.  Such a shame and will never return.

title: Rooftop Lunch
comment: We managed to book lunch on the rooftop terrace and were amazed by the views, which were heightened by the sun coming out. For starters we shared the padron peppers, buratta, house focaccia and the quail scotch egg which were all delicious. The only criticism is that the peppers were extremely spicy. For drinks we had the rose which was surprisingly cheap and lovely. For mains we both had the shellfish pasta with brown crab butter which we agreed was one of the best dishes we had ever tasted, simply sublime. A wonderful lunch in a mesmerising location, we will definitely be back.

title: A busy saturday evening
comment: We popped in here for 'refreshments' before a Jack The Ripper tour and it was absolutely packed and clearly a place to start a saturday night. We got a couple of cocktails and eventually a table was free, the place was buzzing with conversation and people enjoying themselves. At around £10 for a cocktail it wasn't cheap, but then again it is London. We didn't have a chance to check out the roof terrace as again it was really busy. A fine night out in an old school pub.

title: Amazing venue.
comment: Had a drink in the pub first, a meal in the restaurant and had a look at the roof terrace. All fantastic. Will definitely be returning.

title: Excellent Sunday Lunch
comment: Went for Sunday lunch a few weeks ago, probably one of the best we’ve had, really nice atmosphere, excellent overall!

title: Just ok with staff who looked bored
comment: Went on a cold February afternoon to warm up before we went out for the evening. Yes it served drinks but the staff just seemed lack lustre. A bit of a smile or personal engagement would have made all the difference. We were unlucky as it was already cold and there was a beer delivery and we had to endure the main doors being open for nearly half an hour. Understand the reason and we were at the far side but it made me even colder. Would go back but hope for a warmer reception next time. We don't come to London much and a few words of greeting make all the difference. Its always been more than about the drink!

title: Sunday roast on their lovely rooftop
comment: The rooftop of The Culpeper is a popular Sunday lunch spot and for a reason. The views are great and the atmosphere cosy and fun. The Sunday roast is sumptuous and a lots of beer and cocktail options are available to accompany your meal. The Eton mess is a good British quintessentiality to close the lunch. The staff is really friendly and make sure that your meal out actually feels like a meal in your own home.

title: Large group.
comment: Had brunch here with a large group of friends. Service was very good and the food was of a good standard apart from the sausages on the breakfast's x 3 which had not been thoroughly cooked and we're still pink inside.

title: Amazing meal
comment: The best meal and service we have had while visiting London.The meal was delicious and we would definitely go again on our next visit.Superb.

title: Fantastic food, friendly staff, great service
comment: We ate here last Friday evening (11 September). It was quite busy, although all tables were socially distanced and we felt very safe here. Good choice of dishes and the food was exceptional. Service was brilliant and sure it would have been with a smile, if it weren't for the face coverings being worn by all the staff. After our wonderful meal in the first floor restaurant we were found a table in the bar for a drink. whilst it was busy, social distancing and safety was clearly paramount with potential customers being politely turned away at the door when all the tables were occupied. All in all, an excellent night out and would definitely recommend.

title: Unexpected
comment: Excellent food, great restaurant, excellent staff and in a great spot. Wasnt expecting the food to be so delicious and prices are reasonable too. Will definitely go back. The bar can get a little busy but a perfect spot to eat so close to Spitalfield

title: Absolutely delicious!
comment: Friendly greeting from entrance and pleasant service. They source their ingredients locally, their meat in particular. I had the bavette which was pink and tender. This gem is absolutely worth a visit!

title: Late Drinks
comment: Good service over late night drinks after dining.  Service was good and the presentation good. Ordered some nibbles to go with drinks and again nothing was too much trouble - A great find.

title: Good gastro pub
comment: We had a lunchtime meal here and it was amazing, window seat with a view of the world going by, good draught beer to start, friendly professional staff, superb sour dough bread served with anchovy butter. We both had the signature dish, Bavette steak just perfect with a good red wine. Desert was a wonderful apple and blueberry crumble. The atmosphere was quite and relaxed, while of an evening it’s a very lively dining experience.

title: Rude and uninspiring
comment: Booked a table for Sunday lunch very easily on their website based on good online recommendations. However, bar staff seemed most put out to actually serve a few pints and they were not welcoming to a friend who turned up a little late. Food was average, nowhere near the best I’ve had and the drinks were incredibly overpriced even for London. Will not be returning.

title: Great food, atmosphere and team
comment: Had our works dinner for 30. Great atmosphere and the food and staff were brilliant. Really friendly place, with Christmas dinner served on platters for everyone to serve, worked really well. Next time, a return to the rooftop.

title: Well worth a visit
comment: Met friends for lunch in midweek. Quite busy, good sign. Not a huge selection of beers, but some unusual ones, including a very decent "Mad Goose". Menu in downstairs eating area not very extensive, but "Pie of the Day" (lamb, mushroom and carrot) with hispi cabbage was very good, and a selection of starters went down well, with some splendid chips to boot. Popular with large(ish) groups in the upstairs restaurant, which has a larger selection on its menu, and seemingly it has a pleasant roof garden area also. Service was very good and efficient. Would happily return if in the area.

title: Bar staff were lovely- but
comment: Bar staff were lovely- but ruined by the clientele- rude and obnoxious customers. Rudely knocked out of the way, drink spilt over me and just no consideration for others around them.

title: A seven hour lunch....
comment: I went to Culpeper thinking it’s going to be just another average Sunday lunch but I was really really pleasantly surprised... I had the bavette steak roast...it was really really fantastic. Bavette can be badly cooked but this was excellent. Gravy good and a decent amount of veggies and Yorkshire pudding. We all had desert. The chocolate moose was great. I had the pannacotta which was good tasting but was not a pannacotta. Too soft and no form.  Will go again though. Great food.

title: Only one very bland red wine??
comment: They do suggest it’s a Malbec substitute, a Shiraz substitute, a cab sab substitute etc. Truth is it’s a lifeless cheap merlot that I can’t imagine anyone would like? We’ve been using this pub on and off for a few years and due to lack of wine have now spent the last 30 mins on a sat night exploring nearby pubs just to avoid the ‘no nice red wine Fri night scenario’. Such a shame. There’s supermarkets nearby with heaps of £5 bottles they could charge £9 a glass for? A pub that’s lost its heart and doesn’t care

title: No complaints at all
comment: How interesting to read the wide range of reviews for this place. From our experience of eating in the restaurant, not the pub area, my wife and I can only say how delightful we found the whole experience. From a small but varied menu, my wife had lamb and I had a bavette steak; both were cooked to perfection. We shared a cheese board for dessert and that was also very good. The staff were lovely and went out of their way to make us feel welcome. They were happy to vary the accompaniments for the meats to suit our tastes and gave us a taste of a couple of wines before we made our final choice. We were not rushed at all and were able to take our time in a very relaxed atmosphere.  For London, it is reasonably priced. We would definitely go again.

title: Creative pub-food!
comment: Dropped into this pub after a show, and had really nice food. Very different from what I would consider pub-food, and that is perfect for us. Some was a bit too odd, but still - would come back again if I was in London.

title: Trendy pub food - not particularly cheap
comment: I happened to be in London last week and Culpeper came up as highly recommended. The reviews looked decent so I gave it a try. I dropped in for lunch and found the selection of dishes downstairs in the pub quite extensive although all were quite heavy. In the end I went for the fish & chips - a traditional choice for a visitor to the UK I guess. What I got was not particularly large in terms of portions but the fish (haddock) was beautifully flaky and could not have been fresher. The batter was not at all greasy. The chips were just right but the peas were perhaps the most pleasant surprise although I thought the portion of peas was a bit stingy. As a starter I had the black pudding bites, which I thought were disappointing. The choice of drinks seemed limited too.

title: Consistently fantastic
comment: I love this restaurant - a limited but wonderful menu (too much choice would confuse here and make you feel you were missing out on many delicious options), great decor, location and service. I had goats' cheese filo pastries with fig, a main of fish with incredible curried mussels and the chocolate mousse with mint meringue and olive oil was divine. Never fails to impress clients when I take them here. Highly recommended.

title: Raining 😢
comment: No sitting on fabulous top deck as it was raining. Stopped for loo & G&T made with City of London Dry Gin. Girls next to me had a beetroot Bloody Mary which looked great. This is very iconic place close to Spitalfields Mall.

title: Lunch for 6... the good, the bad, the ugly...
comment: Was treated to a business lunch at the above yesterday afternoon...  Great pub atmosphere on the ground floor and THE most helpful chap helped us get a booking upstairs in their restaurant after a mix up with names/booking...  Great food and helpful french waitress in the restaurant, but major attitude problem with the front of house girls in relation to having a drink on the balcony (2nd floor). Forced to book an area on our phones and then told we had to wait 5mins, 5 times with the ever helpful "is that alright" and the customary roll of the eyes... Nobody was up there on the balcony, they just couldnt be bothered to serve. Totally unhelpful, rude and plane lazy. Stay on the ground floor and bring a crash hat if you want to go upstairs

title: Excellent food and atmosphere
comment: Had the croquettes and mackerel pate, especially the last one was very tasty. Excellent service, music and atmosphere as well.

title: Bar qqqqqqqs
comment: Trying to get a drink between 17-19pm on a tues took 15mins every time. The reason, only 2 bar staff and one of them didn’t have a clue. For example, one of the beer pumps ran out, he waited 5 minutes for it to work again before he served anyone else. People just walked out.  Great pub but could be so much better and make more money. If you own this place employ more and better bar staff.

title: Positively surprised!
comment: I Don’t usually go to gastropubs but this one was recommended to me by a colleague. The place has a nice atmosphere and the food was delicious! We had a fish dinner consisting of fish pate, fish croquets and fish chips for the main! I couldn’t fault any of the dishes, the fact that the menu was small really helped as I get lost in massive menus.

title: Oh dear.....the service :'(
comment: We've wanted to go too this pub for a very long time now as supposedly one of the best and it's been recommended to me so many times. I'm a keen follower of their social and really love everything they do from the rooftop to the plants, the food to the interior. Very sad to have to speak to such a snotty and to be honest, downright rude manager over the phone. I appreciate you may be a busy and popular pub but to be so standoffish on a first encounter whilst trying to book a table is crazy! Pretty bad customer service and I don't reckon I'd visit after that experience!!!

title: NO FOOD???
comment: Tried to obtain something to eat - was told we just opened!! Notice there was a certain type of cliental eating and drinking but we were told there's no food!!!

title: Dog hair infused gin!
comment: Dogs are welcome here, also welcome in your drink apparently. Staff are sharp and surprisingly unhelpful. One positive is the money I saved on tips, since clearly none of them wanted tips. Roof top garden is lovely but closes between 4-5. Tables don’t seem to be cleaned, sprinkled with salt and left over food. Wouldn’t be in a hurry back.

title: Lively pub buzzing on a Saturday afternoon
comment: Number three on a Saturday afternoon pub crawl; big friendly pub full of people enjoying a beer and a chat.

title: Staff do not do their jobs properly !!
comment: I called them in the afternoon asking for a rooftop table for 2 people. The girl at the reception told me that there is no booking needed and I should just go there and there might be a waiting list where we need to wait a bit and then we can go in. When we got there, the girl said that unfortunately there is no table available for tonight as there are too many people outside. Why would she not tell me that on the phone so I won't need to travel all the way to this place??? Clearly she doesn't do her job properly, I am very dissapointed with this restaurant. I will never go back there again.

title: Don't waste your money eating here !
comment: My wife and I come to London 2-3 times a year and always stay in the Spitalfields area because it's always bustling and we are near the Spitalfieklds market with loads of great bars and restaurants on tap .   We have eaten here quite a few times, and when we knew we were coming to London again a few weeks ago we booked for Sunday 14th of July. We booked for Sunday lunch with a time of 5.30. We arrived at 5.00 and had a couple of drinks downstairs, then went up to the restaurant area at 5.30 to eat. We shared a white bait which was ok, but nowt special. We had then ordered the Sunday roasts, my wife the chicken, and me the beef.   It arrived and again was nowt special, but to my dismay was stone cold. The waiter asked how was our food, I told him it was stone cold, and he said he'd get another, but it would take 15 mins as they make it all fresh. So my wife was eating here with me sat there waiting for the chefs to make my fresh hot dinner. After a few minutes my wife also complained that gets wasn't hit either, so we asked tgecwaiter if it could be heated up a bit in the microwave, he said they couldn't do that as they don't have a microwave (I find that hard to believe )  After 20 minutes he brought our fresh meals again, and again mine was stone cold, the Yorkshire pud looked like it has been made hours before, and was rock hard, and just disintegrated when I tried to cut it as it was so dried out. My beef wasn't rare, it was actually raw flesh ! The veg was cold and over cooked, it was total garbage, and not fit to feed a dog.   I took the plate back to the chefs and told them in no uncertain terms that this was total garbage, the manager said there was nothing wrong with it, so I asked her to taste it which she refused. We paid for the over priced drinks and average white bait and left. Do not waste your money eating here, there are plenty of other places far better near by. 20 out of 100 food, 10 out of 100 attitude.

title: How to get it SO wrong
comment: It was all set up for a beautiful summer evening on the terrace. England had even won at cricket. Then we were offered just two brands of beer ...both of which were warm. However, that was nothing compared to the rose wine which was actually hot! Food was diabolical... trying way too hard with dishes like kimchi and baba ganoush which were so far off the mark that they couldn’t even claim to be abstract interpretations. Really need to get back to a few basics they can actually cook. Service ... one helpful server, one who was so surly I can only assume she was a Kiwi cricket fan or had been forced to try the hard potatoes we’d been served. We left after a couple of rounds... never to return.

title: Great, friendly atmosphere
comment: This is a good place to relax after visiting Spitalfield market. It’s a traditional pub with food and it’s dog friendly..a bowl of water was brought for our little dog as soon as we sat down! We would have liked to have sat on the roof garden but the weather was so good that it was full...possibly book in advance. There are two menus,a pricier one for the roof terrace and a different one for downstairs. The scrambled egg with smoked salmon on toast was delicious. Staff were friendly and although it was busy, they were happy to take photos of us. The downstairs seating is also dog friendly so if the weather is bad you can still go there with your pooch.

title: Mums 50th Birthday
comment: We went for mums 50th birthday she had a blast we hired the rooftop what a great experience, food with the different wines was exceptional would love to go back staff was brilliant had our own barman to

title: Wayyy Overpriced Mediocre Food
comment: Pub trying to offer fine dining quality food. Nothing fit together on the plate and everything was tasteless. Undercooked. Under seasoned. Thankfully the bread was replenished !

title: Real pub
comment: Exactly what you can expect in a real, British pub. Number of drought beer included, and a fantastic fish and chips. They have much more than that, but even just for that, wellworthy a visit!

title: Got wrong most of what they could get wrong
comment: Left still hungry and disappointed. Went with hopes. A sad sequence of under-performances added to issues. Some recompense but not enough to encourage benefit of the doubt and a repeat visit. Now see similar comments on here. Scene 1 Arrival - Great a table available - its a gastro pub - I'll have a pint of bitter. 5 minutes later The bitter's run out. OK no problem now I've read the menu and the waiter tells me the bavett is a big dish. I'll have eel and Pinot Gris, Bavette with Nero d'Avalo and sparkling water. Scene 2 the £10 eel was 35mm x 20mm, teaspoon of rhubarb and teaspoon creme fraiche - OK I ordered as an experiment 'cos smoked eel isn't something I know. Portion size was a surprise at price but its E1. Now I know smoked eel is significantly similar to smoked mackerel and hey I'l just have a desert Scene 3 the bavette arrives. Another small portion. Yikes its tough to cut, tough to chew and stringy, not that tastie but the Bearnaise helps. C'est la vie. Try the pomme anna - nice and crisp, in places not 100% cooked through, try the baby gem - OH Yuck - Mustard dressing yuck yuck yuck how did I miss that? I didn't - its not on the menu despite being an allergen. Scene 4 Report back the bavette wasn't great, the mustard was horrid and unannounced... Scene 5 Waitress "My college says you didn't like..." "No I say because.... " There is something in her look I don't understand I pause "You asked...its an allergen...its not listed..." she replies "I can't know everyone's tastes and its not my fault" Oh i reply I thought... No I just came to apologies Oh OK thanks for the apology (why am I giving the thanks for whats progressively a declining experience and the attitude I could do without!?) then I go to finish the wine and luckily I spot the slagheap of sediment in the glass - emptied the very dregs of the bottle into the glass. There was an offer of a "splash" Really on top of all the above? It was removed from the final bill - good - but by then I've decided I won't chance a desert and I don't want to stay where I'm giving the thanks for a bad experience and the discussion and recognition still translates to we'll make our profit from you. IF they'd got it all correct I think it would have been good despite some reservations on portion size. IF they'd addressed the issues I could have said "at least..." and felt better about "we all make mistakes..." and I think the waiter was there even if the waitress clearly was not. As it is I'm disappointed, mildly hungry, Almost £50 poorer and pissed-off. None of which is individually too bad but all together is a 2 star. I hope for you none of these factors repeat but I see I'm not the first to note most of my points

title: Loved the pub and the atmosphere but the food was poor
comment: We went for Sunday lunch and sat at a decent table on the ground floor. The beer was well kept and the service warm and friendly. However there is no hiding place and the food was poor, the only decent part was the deep fried nibbles we shared as a starter. The beef roast was just a cheap cut of steak, the fish pie was average with little in the way of chunks of fish. The Mille Feuille for dessert was dry and inedible. A real shame as it's a great London pub with a lovely buzzy busy atmosphere. Need to sort the kitchen out quickly.

title: Great Sunday roasts
comment: Me and my partner went in March for a Sunday roast, and it was fab. Great food, lovely wine, nice atmosphere. Easy to travel too - would recommend booking a table.

title: Service was really terrible
comment: Food wasn't nice and service was bad rude staff dont even bother what customers needs are very sad to say will not come back again

title: Nice Pub!
comment: Nice People, Nice Beer and Cocktails. The Barkeeper mixes all what you want. It's also possible to taste the Beer before you buy it

title: Epic!
comment: The building is beautiful, the food is beautiful, the staff were beautiful! And that’s before you even see the view from the roof garden. Can’t recommend it enough, only hesitation in doing so is I selfishly don’t want it to be harder to get a table.

title: Disappointing
comment: Poor food, terrible service. Our waiter continually disappeared to find out what items on the menu actually were, and took forever to take our order. Food was poor and prices were over-inflated - I know it's in trendy Spitalfields but surely if you're prepared to spend the money it's reasonable to expect decent food in return! It's a really beautiful building and a lovely concept, but poor food and even poorer service is inexcusable. I gave 2 stars because the building is so beautiful...

title: Table of 9 very happy people
comment: Service and cooking were top notch. Some people at the table only had a couple bites while others went for a full 3 course meal. Everything was perfectly seasoned and affordable. The anchovy butter with the bread was a stroke of genius. Will be back next time I’m in london

title: Cocktails
comment: Great bloody Mary’s , fantastic building in a great location friendly helpful staff , was gutted I missed out on the great Sunday lunch but hey there’s always next time

title: The food on the rooftop is overpriced and not realy good
comment: I can not say something about the the pub food or the restaurant, we went to the rooftop for dinner. They have tapas style food from the grill there, we orderd the Rooftop Seafood Pot (1-2ppl £20). We where very disapointed a hand full of not very fresh mussels, about 5 very small pices of octopus and 2 red prawns, that tastet just awfull. Service was nice but that could not save our evening. The rest we had was ok, but very price for the smal portions. So nice for a beer, but do not eat on the rooftop bar.

title: Just popped in
comment: Just popped in on the way to our hotel. We only planned on having a pint but ended up having a few plus some food.  The food was great!! Loads of flavour and the whole place was really delightful. 10/10

title: It just felt a bit over designed
comment: Does everything it says on the can; however this 'lifestyle' template is becoming rather hackneyed. It's fine for a drink but just failed to inspire.

title: Great place!
comment: Great place with a nice atmosphere, nice selection of beers and the ambiance was fantastic. Definitely recommend visiting the rooftop bar!

title: Excellent Gastro-pub
comment: In an unlikely location just behind Aldgate East Station is one of London's best gastro-pubs. Downstairs is a well-appointed bar attracting a young professional crowd. Upstairs is a very welcoming dining room, offering a small but very well-chosen menu of mainly modern variations on traditional British recipes. We took the duck and the bavette, both excellent, with very nicely prepared trimmings. A nice winelist, and friendly service combined to create an excellent and welcoming atmosphere. They didn't put a step wrong.

title: Worst Roast in London
comment: Today I stopped in the Culpeper for a roast dinner. I decided to try the Pork Belly. The menu was very limited but i thought id give the Pork a go.  It was tasteless, fatty and you definitely needed good strong teeth to chew it. This was served with 3 roast potatoes, cabbage, a single carrot and a yorkshire pudding.  The staff asked how the meal was I was honest regarding the meat but this went in one ear and out the other so clearly they dont value customer feedback! Avoid the Pork Belly Roast at all costs overpriced and awful.

title: Decent bar
comment: Popped into this bar to get out of the rain. Pretty decent bar, good range of beers and staff efficient. A good atmosphere and a pretty decent place to spend some time

title: Great Vibe!
comment: I started out on the first floor where the bar is and had a beer before having dinner. Great vibe in the bar area with everyone up and about. The bartenders were very helpful and nice to deal with. I then went up to the second floor for dinner and ultimately decided to go to the third floor (the rooftop) to eat. Please be aware that if you eat on the rooftop it is a very limited menu. If you want a larger menu then I suggest the second or first floor. The food was very tasty (however a little overpriced) and the staff were attentive. The decor of the entire place was very neat and each level had its own feel. Would definitely recommend this for at least a drink!

title: Sunday Lunch
comment: Four of us met here for Sunday lunch. The menu was very limited. One of our party chose Shoulder of Lamb - mostly fat and inedible, when spoke the waiter, he wasn’t interested that we hadn’t enjoyed our meal. We went elsewhere for dessert and coffee.

title: Decent Pub
comment: Busy on a Tuesday ... plenty of staff, quick service at the bar and not bad prices. good atmosphere and nice decor .. you could chose much worst !

title: Good /not good enough
comment: the culpeper is a cozy bar, which extends its style to the top. ground floor is a busy bar (evenings) where you have little trouble if you sleep on the 2nd floor. On the first floor we had breakfast in the morning what the breakfast was simple but very tasty and fresh! just do not expect when you ask for a scrambled egg with salmon that they effectively put raw salmon in little chunks over your eggs. this was not necessary for me and also not tasty in the morning! the dinner was very special and daring very tasty and very fresh, something I would dare to eat regularly. the first time I came into the rooms I was mostly faded damp spots and holes in the walls that I saw. This is apparently their style. it is something special but worth the effort! This also gave the necessary charm to the whole experience. Very nice that there is a Nespresso coffee machine in the room and delicious freshly made chocolate cookies that were replenished daily. THE HYGIENE was ultimately everything except from the bathroom was I really disillusioned mold in the shower edges the walls in the shower were really greasy never to clean off so there was really a layer of fat on all products that were already with the time walked through the toilet behind the toilet glasses but as the worst the toilet brush was literally still full of lumps of toilet paper is verry unfortunate because it costs not much to throw away and just put a new one! At one point I had the feeling that they only want money here in their whole concept from bar-restaurant to hotel and do not want any improvements for this. The experience was fun, instructive and at affordable price for London. Beqeause the hygiëne i give 2stars this is too important  Wegen they solute this i feel free to give more!

title: Awesome vibe, delicious drinks.
comment: Also a hotel, this joint was bumping on a Friday night! Great selection of beer/wine/spirits with an upscale (but not too upscale) flow. Lots of attractive looking peeps and a steezy ye olde Londonney decor.

title: Great venue
comment: Was very fortunate to be invited to the Greenhouse (a conservatory on the top floor)., with a gherkin to rival the concrete version (which lit up when dark). Once I had got my breath back climbing all the stairs, we were treated to a fabulous lunch, including bake Camembert, scallops for starters with carrots wrapped in blankets, plus gorgeous roast lamb served with Kale and potatoes. To finish, the "Tarte Tatin" was gorgeous. So why not score it a 5? As I explained to David, our very attentive waiter, unfortunately the plates were cold, which took away from the gorgeous taste of the lamb. To be fair, David explained that they had not been able to warm plates because of the busy Christmas rush. Would love to return in the summer.

title: Best Food I had in London so far!
comment: The Culpeper is an absolutely lovely place to visit, be it for a drink in the pub on the ground floor, or food in the restaurant on the 2nd floor or on the their rooftop. Both the place itself as well as their food and drinks and lovely staff are a treat, don't miss out on this, it's truly worth it!

title: Steak Tartare to die for!
comment: The steak tartare at the Culpeper is just beyond divine..... the best I can remember having anywhere! I'll be back soon for more - congrats to the chef and the team.

title: Good for drinks - fishy butter, avoid
comment: Go here for drinks often, it is good although busy and pretty pricy. Avoid the restaurant, I just dont understand how someone thinks raw fish is acceptable to be included in butter.

title: Sunday roast at its best
comment: Absolutely satisfied. We googled this place and were advised to book table in advance, which we did luckily. Place was packed. Staff is friendly, I really enjoyed the ambience. We ordered two different roasts - one with horseraddish and steak, other one with lamb shoulder and mint-jelly. Both were great. Small complimentary starter included. Thank you

title: Wonderful Staff
comment: We had a very good experience here. The staff was very efficient and friendly, someone went out of their way to find us a table on a crowded Sunday afternoon. Food was very good with many traditional options and my companions were very happy with their cocktails. I would go back in a mnute!!

title: Just great
comment: Sunday lunch was delicious with interesting starters including steak tartare and mackerel plus sourdough and anchovy butter. Bavette steak with veggies and crisp roasties was brill the lamb less so as a bit fatty but wine was good by the glass carafe and bottle. Bit quieter upstairs as bar is buzzy and staff are super friendly

title: Amazing food, a super breakfast and a lovely stay.
comment: We loved staying here so much we have stayed three times already. Warm atmosphere, friendly staff and awesome food. We love it here. Also very close to local markets and attractions. Take a walk up to Columbia road, and discover all the food outlets along the way. Very nice!

title: Left feeling I wanted more
comment: This place has a lovely vibe and the staff very polite and accomodating. However, both myself and my husband were left somewhat disappointed with our meal from the First Floor Kitchen. The produce appeared to be good but lacked seasoning and there simply wasnt enough of it! Perhaps a little refined for us!!! But, there didnt appear to be any side orders available either. I think the bar menu would be far better for us and looked rather tempting too. I would love to give this place another chance as they obviously are doing something right due to the amount of people there.

title: Great food
comment: Dined here a couple of weeks ago for a work dinner. All of us were very impressed by the food. I had mushroom on brioche for starter followed by the hake. The hake, served with mussels and chorizo, was amazing. The fish beautifully cooked and the flavours perfect.  Look forward to returning in the warmer weather to try out the rooftop bar.

title: Great food and service, cute rooftop bae
comment: The food here was amazing, we were very fortunate to get a table as it was quite busy and we had no booking.  The food was delicious, we were delighted with our meal. The service exceeded expectations.  Ending the evening with a cocktail on the rooftop bar was a great touch. I look forward to returning.

title: Top
comment: I have been here before for drinks and today I found out that they served food too! So... food is amazing and of great quality. Service is great. Much better than many fancy places.  I really recommend this lovely place to everyone!

title: A little disappointing
comment: My wife and I were a little early for our Lunch at RockIT so we decided to pop into the Culpeper for a Coffee. Although it was late morning, about 11.45ap, my wife and I decided to just have a Coffee as we were about to go and eat Lunch at RockIT which is across the way. We did not ask for nor were we offered a food menu even though it was getting near lunch. I had a Cappuccino whilst my wife had a Latte. My Cappuccino was positively cold. In contrast, my wife's Latte was fine. Not exactly encouraging for us to return to try their food, but who knows

title: I eat and drink here whenever I'm in town.
comment: Great little pub, great little restaurant, great little roof top other restaurant. Interesting and well prepared food using their own home-grown veggies. I keep coming back!

title: Amazing Christmas lunch experience
comment: Visited the Culpepper with my work team for Christmas lunch. Had an amazing experience. Service was wonderful throughout. Food was simply amazing. Squid ./ goats cheese filo starters were sublime. Beef wellington / Chicken / Veg tasty and delicious Dauphinoise potatoes - OMG And delightful deserts and wine as well. Highly recommended!

title: Very decent place to stay
comment: My partner and I found the Culpeper a cracking little place to stay. It's very handily located near Aldgate East tube station and is only a short walk from the Shard, Tower Bridge and the Tower of London. Our bedroom was comfortable, warm and stylish and the bathroom clean. Highlight was the excellent breakfast with the best black pudding I've ever eaten! Also worth saying the staff were all very friendly and helpful. Highly recommended.

title: Nice food and friendly service
comment: We had the roof top room and the taster menu.Staff were really friendly and helpful, the food was well cooked and very tasty. There's an optional drinks flight which was good, though not convinced it matches the food. Service pretty good given we were a large table.

title: Excellent standard of food and drink
comment: A menu that changes weekly is refreshing, but a menu that delivers quality is spot on. Lovely meal this evening with friends. Three meat eaters and a vegetarian. Each course is freshly prepared and delicious. Steak Tartar was excellent and so was the duck. Very good service. This is all based on the first floor restaurant.

title: Hot & Hip?
comment: We had a lunch here and the guys liked the craft beer. The food was good. It was more snack type food and all of us left still hungry. We had the soft shell prawn skewers - tasty. A friend had the caesar salad, drenched in mustard. The cherry tart went down well.  It was piping hot in the heatwave and a few people said they really should have umbrellas up here. It became unbearable after 2 hours. Maybe umbrellas would not fit with the look, yet it would be worth having some.  If you go bring a sun hat, fan and spf. The pub downstairs is lovely. I like the concept. Basically I am not a fan of snack type tapas food though, so the roof restaurant place was not for me. The others had mixed reviews. Good service. Enjoy your experience and bring that hat!

title: Cool, chic but not up itself!
comment: This place has a great vibe without being too ‘Shoreditch’. I took my other half there for birthday drinks, dinner and stay over, so we experienced all of the hospitality The Culpeper has to offer.  The pub downstairs is a great space. We sat there sharing tables and people watching for a good couple of hours.  The beer was good and they had 4 different beers on tap (yes he did try them all!) and the team behind the bar took time and care when making me a lovely Old Fashioned or two!  We then went up to the first floor for dinner. A small but very well thought out seasonal menu, that takes care of the carnivores, the pescatarians and the veggies very well. It’s a cost space with about 35 covers and it is smooth, well run but you certainly don’t feel like they are constantly asking you if everything is ok. (One of my bugbears!)  We had wood pigeon wellington and a trout salad to start and then both had the bavette. Very good food at very reasonable prices.  We stayed there too and our room although it was one of the smaller ones was really well appointed with lovely tea and coffee options including fresh milk (yay!) A neat ensuite with a great shower.  And finally, breakfast was fantastic. (I am sure I could see the chef making sausages!) a generous full English with the best soft black pudding I’ve eaten in years!  However, if you are feeling slightly more abstemious then there are loads of different and delicious breakfast options.  Well done to The Culpeper - we loved our stay and we’ll be back!

title: Great London pub with good food
comment: The Culpeper has a lovely feel to it when you walk in - I came on a very hot, sunny day and they had the large glass windows open which meant you got a nice breeze even when sitting inside. The food was lovely, but the service was extremely slow - we spent about 1h30 there in what was meant to be a quick work lunch. However, we did spring a table of 9 on them at short notice. However, they were very apologetic about it, and took 2 desserts off the bill as they took so long to arrive. As for the food itself, I enjoyed it but it was far too salty for me. I had the fish and chips, and everything on the plate seemed to be over-seasoned. Food was also a bit expensive (£14 for fish and chips), but this is a London "gastropub" so is to be expected.

title: Sunday Roast!
comment: I went to The Culpeper for Sunday roast and loved the place! It's a big, light filled, modern pub with quirky decor, good service, a good choice of wines and very good modern British food. I had the traditional Sunday roast that was excellent - good quality ingredients, nice presentation, excellent beef; my friend went for one of the veggie option (eggplants Parmigiana) and that was good too. The starters were fine and we were too full to try desserts. I am not a big fan of English Sunday roast so I can't really rate this as 'excellent' but I will definitely go back.

title: Underwhelming roast
comment: We ate a very poor Sunday roast here (chicken). The meat was dry and flavourless, the potatoes lacking any seasoning. It was also served with ratatouille which does not belong with a roast. The gravy was incredibly watery, devoid of any flavour. It was also annoyingly served on a large plate for us to serve ourselves. I didn't realise I had ordered a sharing platter from Nando's. Very disappointing.

title: Wonderful rooftop with views,garden, fantastic staff and delicious food.
comment: Went to rooftop on Friday lunchtime for family celebration. Booked table in advance. On day weather unpredictable. Arrived and started meal in sunshine. Stunning.Then the rains fell and we were ushered into greenhouse area where a table had been laid for us..just in case! Within a short space of time the sun came out and a great waiter dried off our original table and out we went to enjoy scenery and scents of herbs and flowers.A little later the weather changed again and back we went to greenhouse. Nothing was too much trouble. Absolutely fantastic. And the food was stunning too. We will be back.Thank you.

title: Eating out in a big city
comment: Sorry for empty plates but this place was awesome the food the service the staff atmosphere again sorry for the empty plates but really it’s very good try it fish to die for I can’t enthuse enough try it oh 4 eatin with drinks wine aperitif (I know) £148

title: Great bar, great food
comment: Not your average bar in so many respects. It’s smart, trendy, has two floors and a rooftop terrace. Not unusual for London perhaps, however the bar food served is innovative, tasty and well presented, and all at a great price. Full marks.

title: Family Sunday Lunch
comment: Lovely venue for a relaxed Sunday lunch with the family. They had a table large enough to accommodate all 15 of us (following visit to Secret Studio escape room up the road. Excellent service and friendly atmosphere.

title: As good as ever - great spot for a sociable and out of the City business lunch
comment: Love this place - modern restaurant vibe in an old-school London pub. The restaurant upstairs is just wonderful - had some incredible seafood pasta here, excellent wine by the glass, but the chocolate dessert was out of this world.

title: Mediocre
comment: Nice cosy rooftop with lots of home grown herbs and veg, however the food and drink in the restaurant is underwhelming and overpriced, £30 for a pitcher of unbottled prosecco is just ridiculous.

title: Pleasant return
comment: This was my second visit (see my first review), and overall it did not disappoint. A caponata starter was light, tasty and came with good home-made ricotta. Another starter of asparagi was satisfying in the way basic dishes can be: just a high quality product matched by a well-made accompaniment, in this case a Hollandaise. Pork belly was full of flavour too and immensely satisfying, thanks to the quality of both the produce and the cooking, perfectly matched by a bean cassoulet. But the best dish of the evening was a cod, good, yes, but the show almost stolen by the amazing tomatoes coming with it, donating their sweet flavour and their intense moisture to the dish, with an olive tapenade providing yet another layer. The mains were the peak of our meal. This time we were underwhelmed by the desserts: a very eggy cherry clafoutis with very few cherries, lacking love; and a strawberry Eaton Mess consisisting mostly of lumps of sweet meringue, with little cream and virtually no strawbeeries. Service was pleasant, prices are OK for this area of London and in relation to the quality (and portions are not mean either). I tried a tequila cocktail and wasn't too impressed, but the drink list is interesting. The cuisine here is very direct and unfussy. Most dishes are very simple, but there is cleverness in this simplicity, and when you make the effort of getting high quality produce, this may be one of the best ways to showcase it.

title: Best barman in the city!
comment: Just popped in for a quick drink on a lazy Sunday afternoon with a friend. Amazing customer service from a brilliant barman named Mat, who served us bespoke drinks for us fussy ladies. Wonderful drinks and a lovely atmosphere! Looking forward to this becoming our local :)

title: Really good bar with good food
comment: Really good bar with good food can be standing room only on a weekend. I have been told it's a small hotel but I wasn't aware as we just went for drinks a few times. The bar staff make excellent cocktails.

title: Top bar with a fantastic roof top view.
comment: Obviously being London it’s quite a pricey place to drink for a long period of time, but if you do go here then make sure you go at a time / day that the roof top bar is open. The views are awesome from up there.

title: Sunday lunch
comment: Nice traditional looking pub/restaurant with a fairly extensive but different menu with that traditional feel. There were three in our party and we all had the lamb Sunday roast and I think we were all in agreement it was very good. The staff were brilliant despite no internet so no card payment facility at the time. The pub is a short stroll from Liverpool st station and you can wander through Petty Coat Lane market. In all a very pleasant experience.

title: Great pub!
comment: In London for a few days just to eat, drink, and have a good time. The Culpepper was by far the best pub we’ve visited. Harry (the security) was awesome and so personable. He gave us great suggestions for food and where to watch the England World Cup match. Thanks for a great evening!

title: Great pub & roof terrace
comment: The ground floor bar looked really good but we headed straight to the roof terrace. Surrounded by plants, herbs and foliage with the backdrop of tall buildings from the City made this roof terrace the best pub roof garden I’ve been to. I will return to try the food.

title: As good as a gastropub gets
comment: Nicely designed and decorated. Excellent selection of real ales. Top quality service. Generous portions of well-cooked and tasty food. But it's the little extra touches that lift this place above the average. The anchovy butter with the bread was divine, and the home made tartare sauce with the fish made you realise just how awful the package stuff is. Superb lunch.

title: Nice brunch
comment: Really nice pub with quick food service. It gets very busy so worth trying to book in advance. The menu is quite small but we were very happy with all the food that we ordered. I would highly recommend the poached eggs and the ham hock.

title: Expensive and very 'Shoreditch', but just about worth it
comment: We had an early lunch here at noon, I was taking three clients out, all of whom are brilliant and under the age of 25; I'm not. Within two minutes we talking expansively about which type of gin to have with our tonics, so I knew I was in Shoreditch. We stayed for 80 minutes and the bill was (somewhat) high at more than £200, but that was probably because we were played when it came to the gin. The food was a tad pretentious, but nothing particularly wrong with that when it was so delicious. The waiter/waitress service was, as you expect, as if we were privileged to be speaking to them (not least about gin). Still, it was fun and a good start to the afternoon. I would give it a try, but stick to the food, not the (many times aforesaid) gin. I'll probably go back.

title: Outrageous
comment: Was very excited to visit the Culpeper with my friends this week. We had reserved a table on the roof for some drinks and possibly dinner. We decided at the table not to order food after all and proceeded to drink the Sangria we had ordered. We were later told that we HAD to order food, otherwise we would be charged £15 per head for sitting at the table. The waitress insisted that this was a) stated in the booking telephone call (it wasn’t) and b) on the confirmation email. Having left, and checked the email it definitely isn’t stated. It specifies that you will be charged if you do not turn up or cancel within 24 hours (understandably) but there is not mention of being charged for not choosing to order food. Waitress said that they had turned away tables (despite there being multiple empty tables whilst we were sat there). We also offered to leave straight away - bearing in mind we had only been there for 20 minutes.  We asked for the bill after deciding we didn’t want to eat (considering there was only minimal options for my vegan friend), we asked to speak to the manager again but no avail to discuss our decision. We left after paying just for our drinks only to then receive a curt email stating that the charge had been taken without any prior warning.  Outrageous service. Definitely will not be returning - which is a real shame as the setting was lovely.

title: Disappointing end of the lunch
comment: First time here , and I invited some friends to enjoy the experience together . Food and drinks great ( a little bit overpriced but well we had a great view ).  We ordered a last round of drinks which we didn’t managed to finish by 4pm ( when we suppose to leave ). The attitude of the manager was rude telling us to leave , even though we said when the next booking arrives we going to stand up and leave , (she was keep telling us the booking is there waiting .).We didn’t finish and we left because the way she reacted was ridiculous , in our way out nobody was waiting ( and trust me is just one way out the “stairs”) . Never again .

title: Quirky pub and restaurant with rooms
comment: Great pub with excellent food. We had a number of small plates and they were all very good.Loved the sourdough bread. There is also an open-air garden/restaurant on the roof - very quirky! It is possible to stay overnight as they have a few rooms. The rooms were very comfortable with lots of little extras like bottled water, an electric fan and home-made cookies.Due to its position on a main road however - it is fairly noisy at night - particularly if you have the window open.Just be prepared and dont go to bed too early ! Overall a very enjoyable stay.

title: Excellent pub and restaurant
comment: I meet up with 2 particular friends about 3 times a year. They always choose the restaurant and it is always great. This time was my turn and we were not disappointed. The ambience and food were excellent and wine list was very good indeed. We shared the beef wellington between us and the accompaniments were fries and gem lettuce, lovely. We had a drink on the roof top after dinner, which was quirky esp the 7 foot cucumber

title: Great atmosphere
comment: Wonderful vibe, great local scene and quality food. Bar staff was friendly, and the food was very creative and unique for being a genuine and casual feeling pub

title: Customer service doesn’t deserve 1 star
comment: Went into here for my Brothers 40th birthday, I bought a cocktail which was £10 (very fair price). However, I did not like this drink and spoke to my sister.. saying that she shouldn’t buy a cocktail as they’re disgusting.. before she has the chance to reply, a barman whom I had not spoken to beforehand replied “the problem is not within here *shaking the glass* but with you.  I found this extremely rude, and the rest of my family were also flabbergasted at such a response from a member of staff. Following this, another member of staff were rude to my brother, which we then all decided to leave. Absolutely disgusting customer service. WILL NOT RETURN (Blonde long haired man, and female bartender were absolute jokes when it came to customer service)

title: Great pub in the east
comment: Lovely pub, great Sunday roast and excellent espresso martinis.  In the summer there’s a lovely rooftop,.

title: Nice atmosphere, disappointing service
comment: Sunday roast was a bit of a miss. While the steak with trimmings was very good, the roasted chicken was surprisingly below par. What’s more, staff seemed incapable of handling special requests appropriately making this an unpleasant experience.

title: Brilliant Sunday lunch
comment: Absolutely fantastic Sunday lunch, super atmosphere, and an excellent selection of craft beers. Staff are friendly and attentive. Really couldn't fault it.

title: Sunday roast
comment: Easy to book a table online. There was not a choice of meat for the roast Sunday lunch, but having said that the pork belly, and the whole meal was delicious. The meal, for two, is served on a huge plate and then you help yourself to what you want. Good coffee. Friendly staff, attentive service. Easy to find (opposite Petticoat Market). Recommended.

title: Only drinks
comment: We popped in here for a quick drink after work. Some of us had the food which was thoroughly enjoyed. It's a great pub with a good selection of alcohol on offer. Definitely recommended if you're in the area.

title: Great pub, great beer
comment: This pub has a relaxed vibe with some nice squashy chairs and little nooks to sit in. It gets really busy post work on a Friday but that means a buzzing atmosphere. Good beer selection, although only 1 IPA. Not crazy expensive either.

title: No Commercialism here
comment: I love a real buzz when walking into an establishment for the very first time so no disappointment here. A Monday night after work, cold and gloomy outside but step into this warm and welcoming characterful corner building to be greeted by service with a smile, comfy banquettes and a crackling atmosphere. Cheers!

title: Lads Day Out
comment: Although we are all regulars to the area, none of our party had been to this pub. As with 'all' the other drinking establishments of the area its very 'hip and trendy' as we're the beers on tap which was a complete letdown. Not being a lover of the 'London Brewery' scene that's been growing for some time, this all that this place (appears) to sell. It's popular but just not for me...

title: Excellent Sunday Roast
comment: Finding a place that does a decent Sunday Roast anywhere near or in London, is very much a rarity. Either the meat is sub standard, or the potatoes and veg have seen better days, So it's with great delight that we had Sunday lunch on the ground floor of this expansive pub; itself done up in a thoughtful mix of traditional and modern. Even on a busy Sunday (and it does get busy and bustly), the staff were very welcoming, friendly and attentive. We had a selection of starters which were generally very good indeed; tasty and well presented. The main courses (although not 'Roasts' in the traditional sense) were excellent. The bavette steak and pork belly came on platters and were excellently cooked and full of flavour. The accompanying roast potatoes, Yorkshire puddings and cauliflower cheese were really good. A very small criticism being that it left an overall impression of being just a touch salty, although this may just be down to individual food selection and my low salt threshold. The desserts, particularly the Chocolate Lava Cake, rounded off the meal nicely. Coupled with an extensive wine, beer and cocktail list, my faith in the 'Traditional Sunday Roast' has been restored.

title: Won't be returning - rude staff that overcharged on drinks bill
comment: Nice pub downstairs. The food in the restaurant is really lovely. But the staff leave something to be desired. One woman was particularly snappy. I asked for drinks several times that never turned up. I didn't realise till I got home we had been overcharged for drinks too. We were meant to hang around after dinner but left soon after. It's a shame as it totally spoilt a really good night. Won't be returning.

title: Expensive small portions
comment: VIsited for lunch and ordered the cured salmon, on pickled cumcumbers. This is £8 and appears in the main meals section of the menu. When the meal came, it was served on a side plate! There were just a few thin fragments of salmon spread around the plate on finely sliced cucumber. That was it. Hardly going to fill anyone. Lucky I'd ordered a portion of chips (which were outrageously priced at £4) to pad it out. Other people in my group ordered the fish and chips (£13), which looked slightly more filling. Left hungry and feeling ripped off.

title: Super Place!
comment: Nice drinks, friendly staff and very good food.  Industrial decor, mix of metal and wood, with quirky lights.  Good location and nice layout of chairs, tables etc.  Restaurant upstairs worths a visit too. Go there every time I come to London!

title: Random walk past
comment: I only came in because I wanted a quick drink , I ended up having a pretty good red  snapper drink ( Bloody Mary with gin instead of vodka ) and a stunning bavette steak Sunday lunch , with out a doubt one of the nicest Twist on a Sunday lunch I have had in London , the steak was juicy and tender , the cauliflower cheese was stunning crisp on top and perfectly cooked , and the Yorkshire pudding was pretty much as good as I get back home in the north east of England where we are famous for Yorkshire puddings , the waiting staff and barman who were working could not have been more helpful in serving me drinks and food . Stunning food and drinks

title: Drinks only and very good!
comment: Went here for drinks and it did not disappoint. Very busy room -lovely atmosphere. If tripping around this part of town, well worth a visit!

title: Excellent modern British Pub
comment: A good choice of beers and foods, with lovely interior design. Staff provided great service and I would definitely come back!

title: very good all round
comment: This is more of a gastropub than a restaurant with limited but good menu and nice rustic atmosphere in the 1st floor dining room. We all had different things, maybe only the squid as a starter was a bit soggy but everything else was good,. Extensive wine list, fair overall prices and friendly service.

title: Poor, overrated in general
comment: I appreciate that the place had character. My starter was good. But my main the baked cod was truly awful.

title: Christmas Friends Meal
comment: A group of 12 of us booked for a Christmas meet up, we were seated up stairs on a long table. The building and deco is lovely old/modern mix. The food was shared platters- absolutely delicious. Great amount a food and the sharing style meant you could have more than one dish. The beef wellington and potato dauphinoise were particularly good.

title: Great service, excellent food
comment: The staff at Culpeper did everything they could to make my experience there enjoyable. I called them to tell them I would be late for my reservation, and that was not a problem. I ordered the steak roast lunch - Medium Rare. However, it was a little rare for me (Maybe personal preference or the kind of steak it was), I asked the waitress to ask the chef to go over it for a few minutes. It came out delicious.. the whole meal was amazing. Thankyou

title: Unplanned. Excellent.
comment: Had met here for a drink with 9 old friends ahead of a booking at a nearby famous Pakistani curry institution. On arrival at the curry house, they refused to acknowledge our booking and invited us to join the 40 long queue. We weren’t impressed so we returned to the warm, welcoming arms of The Culpeper to plan our next move. Having eaten here before we knew it was good, so not expecting there to be a table for 9, we asked anyway... The response was outstanding. Within 15 minutes we were seated upstairs and being served charmingly by the staff. Good wine flowed, we shared 3 delicious starters (the anchovy butter however has a niche audience) and then 8 of us moved onto the shared beef bavette. Outstanding. One friend inexplicably chose something else, but it also looked good.  Great work Culpeper - more than a silver lining; should just have eaten here in the first place!

title: Busy pub with a lively vibe
comment: Popped in here at 6pm on Friday evening to meet our son who works nearby on Brick Lane. The pub was full - standing room only but great, lively atmosphere. Modern decor and good choice of drinks. Didn't eat here as already had other plans so cannot comment on the food but we would definitely go here again if only for drinks.

title: Nice cold beer on a sunny afternoon
comment: Four of us had a quick drink in Culpeper on one of the few sunny afternoons we had this summer. Unfortunately, the roof garden was full and we were not allowed to even have a look, but we were happy enough to sit in the bar. Just had a beer but it was a really nice pub; lovely atmosphere and very nicely decorated

title: Great food drink and service
comment: Went there for a snack and some food with friends. We sat on the roof garden. The drinks were really good, especially the cocktails. We also had the steak and the lamb off of the BBQ which was outstanding. The service there on all levels was exceptional, they clearly take time to pick friendly and helpful staff. Would recommend

title: So we are back!
comment: We liked it so much we came again! This time the roof top terrace was open and what a treat. The weather was stunningly hot so breakfasting on the terrace was absolute perfection. Surrounded by the ghastly yet impressive skyscrapers of eastern London we ate delicious food and enjoyed our rooms as much as last time. Ps the elderflower cocktail is a must!

title: Excellent stay!
comment: Spent three nights here on a trip to introduce my grumpy Scottish boyfriend to London and it didn't disappoint. Two minutes walk from Aldgate East tube with well appointed rooms on the second floor. Room was small (but this is London) but comfortable and very clean. Despite being on a main road and above a heaving pub and restaurant the room was remarkably quiet at night. Breakfast the next morning was very tasty with generous portions. An excellent stay, and a bargain too! Will be recommending to all my friends and family!

title: A warm welcome and excellent service
comment: Our daughter had recommended staying at The Culpeper and my wife and I were down in London for a concert so we decided to stay the night. We were not disappointed with any aspect of our stay from the warm welcome with the first drink on the house to the exceptional full English breakfast the next day. Our room was decorated in the Culpeper style and very clean and well-appointed with a bijou en-suite well-stocked with toiletries. Whilst the pub is popular and busy, the noise from below does not travel up to the bedrooms which have double glazed windows anyway. Every member of staff was onside with the fact that the customer should be treated well. We have to single out Tamsin, who was looking after check-in and was also maitre-de in the restaurant. She was professional and ultra- helpful. The prices were reasonable for London and transport links are great with Aldgate East tube station five minutes walk away. Thoroughly recommend this great pub/restaurant/hotel.

title: Cool Spot Near Spitalfield's Market
comment: This multi-floor versatile property houses a street level pub, upstairs restaurant, + a 5 room boutique hotel and a rooftop garden spot for private events as well as public dining when open.  We stopped in for drinks and found the staff very welcoming + easy to order. We'd wished we did not already have dinner plans because the food coming out of the kitchen really looked great.

title: Good
comment: Had a double date here on a Saturday night. Food - it was good and tasty, but nothing to shout Home about. Portion size could’ve been slightly bigger, but I’m a big eater... Creme brûlée was really delicious. Service - really good and attentive. One negative thing - we were told when we were close to finishing up that they needed to the table. Fair enough, as we had been there for around 90 minutes. But the host came back again to remind us and then started moving all the tables around us to push them together while we were getting up. Literally as soon as we stood up they moved our table and i thought it wasn’t very professional as we’d just spent a lot of money. But on the whole it was good and 3 out of 5 is fair.

title: Very good food but will go a la carte next time
comment: Came here in a big group for our Xmas dinner. The pub is located on Commercial Street about 2 minutes walk from Aldgate East station. Very nice decor, especially downstairs, in an industrial chic kind of of way.  Had a drink downstairs to start with and got served pretty quickly despite the crowds. Good range of drinks including locally brewed beers. I must admit I was sceptical of the Xmas dinner menu arrangement - as a group you had to vote for your favourite dishes and those that got the most votes would be served and shared, i.e. no individual servings. This meant that if you are a very fussy eater you could theoretically end up with nothing you like. I decided to go vegetarian as that actually guaranteed your own starter and main.  The starters were enjoyed by all, though the omnivores struggled with the vegetable tart as it was really too small to be cut up and shared amongst so many. It also created a colossal mess on the table. For the main course, the omnivores got a real feast of meats and side dishes; whereas the vegetarians got a tiny portion of angel hair past with pesto and a few slivers of jerusalem artichoke and no sides (if the vegetarians were meant to get a share of the other sides that was not explained). The vegetarian portions were so small we had to go and order some chips to have enough to eat. Seeing that the vegetarian meal cost the same as the non-vegetarian meal that struck us as pretty outrageous. The pasta also seemed like an odd choice for a Xmas meal even though the taste was good.  The beef was very rare, which was enjoyed by some, but those who prefer their meat more well done struggled to eat it. Dessert was shared by all and the huge quantities of crumble and cheese served definitely made up for lack of vegetarian main course. We all ended up incredibly full. Overall the concept of the meal didn't go down that well, but everyone really enjoyed the food itself. It's rare to get a good Xmas meal in a group but we all agreed that the quality of the food was excellent. Seating was a bit tight and made the sharing more difficult and messy. The service was extremely good and Fabio who served us was utterly brilliant.  I have every intention of returning to have some more of the food but will definitely go a la carte next time and probably opt for the meat rather than the vegetarian option.

title: Good luck getting served if you're not blonde
comment: Met a group of friends for drinks on a Friday, so predictably very busy. It was almost impossible to get any of the bartenders' attention to be served - they seem to only notice blonde women! We all noticed this, and decided it was not worth it to wait 20mins at the bar trying to make eye contact. Also, the tables and floor were really dirty, lots of dirty glasses and spillage that had not been cleaned.

title: Cucumber
comment: The roof terrace in the summer is the place to sit, although you will have to book well in advance and hope it doesn’t rain.

title: Really good pub
comment: Nice place to go for the evening for a few drinks. Good range of beers. Excellent atmosphere. Not tried the food yet.

title: Rooftop food is absolutely amazing
comment: The sad news is that you cannot book the rooftop tables and it's relatively small. But the good news is that the food is absolutely stunning. Amazing meats, salads...absolutely everything is flawless. The view's aren't bad either!

title: Very nice place in suburbs of shorditch
comment: It is a super nice place with modern interior always filled with crowd of young professionals. Stuff is friendly and most importantly not everybody knows this place is open till late - as in later then any other pub in the area. Cul!peper!

title: Our Go To Place To Stay
comment: Great location for exploring the E1 area as well as easy access to central London. Two minutes walk from Aldgate East and 5 -10 minutes from Liverpool Street tube stations. Flesh pots of Shoreditch, Hoxton and E1 in general all within easy striking distance. We primarily use this as a hotel. There is a flat rate price of £120 per night including breakfast, complimentary cocktails on arrival, and 10% off food and drink during your stay. Rooms are very well appointed. Someone has gone to a lot of trouble to take the rooms back to a dilapidated, Victorian look but this is far from a shoddy building. Very good beds, spotless bathrooms and good quality coffee/ toiletries. Love the historical books on the area. Breakfast is taken in the restaurant and is very special. Full range of cereals, bread and pastries cooked on the premises and superb cooked options (try the Harissa Eggs). Left luggage facilities and a separate side entrance if the bar is closed. We ate a light lunch on the Roof Terrace. I know there are mixed reviews but the test is trying to get a table up there. The bar does stay open late but we found noise was not an issue. Great place, real character, very good staff, and not a plastic chain hotel - what is not to like?

title: Used as a base to get to World Athletic Champs
comment: Had a one night stay here in August. Arrived a little early to check in. Staff were brilliant and kept us informed all the way until the room was ready. Had lunch whilst waiting (shoulder of lamb) which was exquisite. My wife had caponata with ewe's cheese which almost turned this confirmed carnivore's head! Our room was fantastic and had lots of the facilities that some more expensive hotels don't e.g. Nespresso machine, rain forest shower, Ruark hi-fi. A free cocktail (and a couple after) followed which were unique really and new to us (and we know cocktails!). We visited the roof garden which is quite small but charming and a little piece of bucolic greenery in the City. Bed was extremely comfy and the room surprisingly quiet considering it's on a main arterial road. Breakfast the next day was even better than lunch. A full English with french black pudding-that should be an affront to this Lancastrian but it was too good to fault. All in all a cracking stay. We've been lucky to stay in some good hotels lately such as the Z, Citizen M and the Hoxton but this beats them all and is much cheaper at £120 a night including breakfast and cocktails. Close to the tube too-get down there!

title: Excellent food
comment: Had lunch here and it's so close to Spittalfields but away from the throng. Decent eating environment with lots of space and small quality menu. I had the Hummus , pickled red onion, fennel , dukkah with flatbread it was excellent and the flavours worked well. My wife and son had the fish and chips which looked so tasty The feedback was that the batter was lovely and crisp, the fish moist and tasty and the chips complemented the meal. Free bottled water on the table and free bread and a tasty Anchovy butter while waiting Overall a lovely decent priced lunch that I would recommend to visit.

title: Ambitious menu - good delivery
comment: Great meal here. Menu looked a bit OTT - limited range but well thought through - but the delivery was bang on!! Cosy atmosphere and great service, with excellent cooking - will deffo come back ....

title: Friendly and relaxing
comment: Had a lovely evening celebrating a birthday - service was perfect, relaxed but attentive and kind. Food was tasty with some unusual twists - goats milk ice cream delicious. Lighting, decor and table spacing spot on too.

title: Lunch in the sun
comment: Beautiful rooftop terrace. If you get there early enough you get a table straight away, otherwise there's a waiting list. The waiters are very attentive and polite. Food is great, cocktails are innovative. I recommend you visit this place, especially when the sun is out.

title: Trendy place with great food
comment: Went here for lunch with my partner. Place is very stylishly decorated and food was excellent. Also have a decent range of beer in bottles. We sat downstairs but looked as though they also have a upstairs restaurant and roof terrace. Will go back.

title: Sadly all a bit average for the price
comment: Had dinner here recently after reading glowing online reviews. Food from the short menu was not bad but nowhere near the standard it should be for the price. Wine list was again short but had some interesting choices to be fair. Restaurant interior was a bit "hipster by numbers" we felt (is presenting both starter and main on chipped plates cool now or did no one really notice this ?) and the turquoise banquet seating was a bit of an eyesore to be honest. Service was very "casual" to say the least, a bit amateur at times but mostly well meant. Overall a pretty average dinner and experience and way too expensive. A shame really as the pub downstairs where we had a drink before and after our meal was fine - great drinks selection and very nice bar staff. We were going to try their other (new) site for Sunday lunch but have shelved that idea now.

title: Absolutely awful
comment: Had lunch in the rooftop area. Unbelievable rip-off. A single sausage cost £8 and the radish salad was, literally, a load of mud covered radishes, some of which were dry as a bone. No seasoning and a distinctly average sauce. Vegetable portions were minuscule and ridiculously over-priced. Worst lunch I've had in London.

title: Amazing rooftop - well kept secret!
comment: The whole interest of this pub is the rooftop terrace! It is very welcoming and is a vegetable garden at the same time. You can't be served the same menu as Inside, but they have a selection of sausages and meats, as well as nibbles and excellent desserts. Drinks are great too! Note that you cannot book in advance. A great place to go for lunch or dinner when the sun is out!

title: Really bad cocktails
comment: Had a few drinks on the rooftop, which is a really nice and peaceful spot. Unfortunately the cocktail experience was an absolute disaster.. the quantity in the glasses is ridiculously small for the price you pay. As a fan of Negroni I can tell this was the worst Negroni's variation I've ever tried. Luckily it was over in litterally 2 sips...

title: Nice bottomless brunch with friends
comment: It's very central and easy to get to. The atmosphere is friendly and te staff are helpful. We were quite a demanding bunch as there was 12 of us for a birthday but they coped really well. The place has a nice vibe, was nice and busy but not too busy and the food was good. The only thing I would say is they had no meat on the menu which made it a little difficult for some. Overall would definitely go back though and I love the fact that their cocktails are based om yhe herbs they grow on the roof :) so they are seasonal....lovely idea!

title: Great Sunday Roast
comment: Popped in here last Sunday for lunch and was really impressed. Great produce and the roast chicken was two die for. A really nice touch to get sourdough bread with anchovy butter for free to start with. Highly recommended.

title: I love this place
comment: I've eaten and The Culpeper twice in the last two weeks and probably a dozen or more times since they opened. I love this place. Great pub-ish vibe with excellent food (including veggies they grow themselves).  They've got a small hotel upstairs too but I've never been able to stay there ... they're always booked.

title: Awesome Roof Garden
comment: Pub worth writing home about - traditional, huge plus a leafy roof garden. Not the cheapest, but prices you expect for what it is.

title: Nice atmosphere, good food
comment: We ate fish and chips here. Easy to get to from our hotel. Nicely decorated. They have a full bar- had a traditional margarita, not bad. We were there on a Sunday evening.

title: Great Sunday Lunch
comment: Service was warm, friendly and attentive. The menu appears to change very regularly so on the Sunday we visited our meat options were pork belly or bavette (steak). We tried both and they were delicious, the bavette especially. My only complaint was the veg were covered in a strong mustard dressing which was quite overpowering. It would have been better if this was mentioned on the menu so we could have asked for the dish without it. Good local beers served.

title: Good
comment: This place is probably one of the best in east London, need more seats and less rude customers for sure .

title: The fit boyz!
comment: We were greeted by a wonderful young lady at the door who seated us with a beautiful smile...Diogo served us (upstairs)he was wonderful in his pink shirt not to mention how he made us feel special and gave us great fantastic service all rounds we had a fabulous time and will recommend to friends and family and be back soon.  Thank you for a lovely Sunday treatment

title: Lively pub!
comment: Lively pub with bedrooms for booking just upstairs. (highly recommend the rooms, by the way) Always a good crowd and a really nice aesthetic feel to the place. 3 minute walk from Aldgate East station.

title: Great roof deck
comment: Had a wonderful drink and yummy snacks with a friend on the beautiful roof deck. You should go there. The view can't be beat.

title: One of my favourite Gastropubs in London
comment: Great food. Expensive though but its certainly a meal you walk away though and are pleased you paid up. Great atmosphere downstairs too and they have a rooftop up the top. One the verge of fine dining in the restaurant on the first floor. Will continue to come back here as the food and service is top notch.

title: Great place for drinks or dinner!
comment: The bar is gorgeous, cocktails are good. The restaurant upstairs is very nice as well. But if you think that you can get a table at the last minute, you'll need to be very lucky. So book in advance so that you can enjoy both.

title: Could be better
comment: This pub with rooms is in a great location just two minutes walk from Aldgate East tube station, across the road from petticoat lane and round the corner from Brick Lane. We arrived about 3.30pm and were asked to have a drink whilst our room was checked. Half an hour later a woman who had been sat about three feet away from us asked us if we were waiting to check in. It seems no one had bothered to tell her! The room itself was fine, secondary double glazing shuts out most of the traffic noise but I can imagine it would be very hot in summer. Our overhead lights did not work which we reported the following morning. We were told they would be looked at but it seems that the only thing done in our room all day was that the bed was made.
