There was no evidence anyone had cleaned the bathroom and the towels were not changed - not even the ones we left on the floor. I heard a member of staff complaining about the cleaner so maybe we were not the only ones to suffer. On the plus side, breakfast was superb, I love the refurbishment and the shabby chic feel to the place.The staff were friendly and apparently eager to please but there seems to be a general lack of coordination.

title: Awesome rooftop
comment: It's got a pretty cool and hip space, but the rooftop is really the soul of the business. So awesome to get some sun up there!

title: Lunch on the rooftop terrace
comment: We had lunch on the rooftop.  The menu is a bit weird, you have to pick some meat (like sausage or a bavette), and then some veggies to go with it. Veggies were in very small portion. Meat was ok. There was a hair in my radish. I thought it might be one of mine so I didn't say anything. Wine was tasteless. We had dessert, and I had ANOTHER hair in my chocolate dessert. I clearly pulled it out of the dessert. I showed it to the waiter, who asked me if I found it on the napkin. I said no and showed it was covered in chocolate.  He didn't say anything, and didn't even apologized.  I won't go back. Too bad as the rooftop is nice.

title: Good bar
comment: Went there for a few beers before dinner.  Lively atmosphere and good choice of beers on tap. Will go again.

title: A very cool pub
comment: Rooftop terrace, bar and restaurant? What more do you want? The atmosphere of this pub is cool and the interior - full of plants and quirky features, makes this place the perfect spot to enjoy a gin and tonic or a bite to eat. The rooftop terrace is popular so make sure you arrive early to ensure a spot!

title: Huge portions!
comment: Went there for dinner. Had the fish and chips which was huge! Good but not spectacular. My cocktail was nice. Nice ambience though

title: Nice pub with original features
comment: The Culpeper – A London Pub, 40 Commercial Street hotel restaurant and pub. Beautiful features in a well preserved Victorian building. The pub area is quite large with tables and bench seating, the restaurant upstairs is a mixture of booths and tables. Service wasn’t the best, in that it took a while to get someone’s attention but the food was good and the atmosphere pleasant. A nice local for people in the area and for anyone organising a get together with friends, everything under one roof.

title: Meal with family
comment: The rooftop was a lot quieter and the staff were attentive. Small choice of menu but food was really tasty.

title: Popped in for a few drinks....
comment: Was in for a few drinks with friends whilst on business in London. Nice friendly atmosphere, helpful and cheery staff and a good range of lagers and beers. Good looked good although didn't eat here.

title: Good Food, Nice People, Good Atmosphäre
comment: Its Easy going. Food and selection drinks are amazing. A real good Pub. Better make sure that there is al Table available. Or you have to stand.

title: Good interior but very noisy!
comment: Not sure if this wants to be a pub or a restaurant - a lot of space is given over to the latter. Whilst it's a pleasant interior at busy times you'll struggle for a seat - a very larger bench table doesn't help here. In the warmer months we'll try the roof garden. It is noisy though - hard surfaces and no soft furnishings - and you will probably have to shout your conversation. A plus is to have Meantime ales on tap which in itself makes the visit worth while.

title: A Sunday Lunch Visit
comment: Poor. The choice was beef and it was tough. Dried out roast pots and the veggies were poor. Will not return especially at the prices they charge for poor fare.

title: Birthday
comment: We came for stars.. for a birthday.. veggie food great.. but with all against us laura made our night. Wind rain and cloudy nights didn't stop her from making a smashing night for us.. and our knowledgeable night sky guide was great too x

title: Full to the rsfters
comment: In contrast with many other eating on or near Commercial Street which were largely empty this Saturday lunchtime The Culpeper was fairly bursting at the seams with drinkers and diners alike. Perhaps it's because unlike many of its rivals, it adapts at weekends to what appears to be an egg-based brunch formula. Scrambled eggs with slices of Bayonne ham was enjoyed by my wife, whilst my daughter had an exemplary croquet Monsieur. I had a more conventional cottage pie served in an earthenware bowl with a side dish of rather refreshing kale, a green I'm pleased to see is coming back into favour. By the time it came for desserts such as creme brûlée orvrhubarb crumble, or even a choice of four cheeses, the noise from all the other drinkers and diners was proving a little overwhelming so we left a bit prematurely.

title: Great!
comment: Small rooftop patio is lovely for drinks when the weather is warm. Inside decor is beautiful and the atmosphere is always really lively. Great spot!

title: Good but
comment: Excellent place good London vibe. Great staff friendly atmosphere, only downside was the noise from the road.

title: I had the worst experience ever in the restaurant upstairs.
comment: Honestly speaking the pub downstairs looks amazing but I had the worst experience ever in the restaurant upstairs. Food was terrible, uncooked and disgusting.

title: Great
comment: Nice and friendley staff, good surroundings and great beers. Went here on a sunday for a drink and a bite, kitchen closses at 6 so only drinks for us

title: Try the sloe gin fizz
comment: We didn't eat here but stopped for a couple of drinks. They had a lovely looking cocktail menu but I only got as far as the sloe gin fizz as it was too tasty! If you're in the area it's a nice place for a stop.

title: Worst Sunday Roast Ever!!
comment: My daughter booked this pub for a Sunday roast as I was visiting her. On first impression it seemed nice and was busy which always is a good sign. I ordered the roast lamb which was on the standard menu and my daughter ordered the gnocchi. Well all I can say it was the worst roast I had ever had!  The lamb was just a slab on my plate, a bit like a doorstep. The vegetables were covered in a burgundy colour so I couldn't actually make out what they were and the worst were the roast potatoes which seemed to be reheated and glazed in another layer of oil and re used again and again! I complained that they were rock hard and they brought the same out again, couldn't eat it. There was no fresh veg as you would normally get with a proper roast and no colour to the dish. The only good thing about it was the huge Yorkshire pud that came with it. Disappointing!

title: Good food and dogs friendly!
comment: After an hour spent looking for a place to eat with our little dog, we finally found this place that is dogs friendly! The food was nice, the staff exquisite and we had plenty of time to eat and chat. Very relaxed atmosphere, spacious and full of light. Perfect for a Sunday roast. Portions are decent size. Not on the cheap side. Would definitely go back.

title: Fabulous Valentine's treat
comment: Visited with the Mrs on Valentine's eve and was well impressed by the ambiance, food and drinks, but most importantly, the helpful and knowledgeable staff. Simon and Josh took real good care of us. They knew their job well, answered all our questions patiently. The food was excellent.. we had the Duck hearts and squid risotto for starters, the rib eye steak to share for mains and the chocolate dessert, with a bottle of red (Rhone) and everything was perfect.  Totally recommend this place.

title: Meal
comment: Had a lovely chicken, mushroom & leek pie with kale. Nice meal and good atmosphere pleasant staff. The only problem is the limited choice

title: Excellent buzzing bar and trendy hotel!
comment: Good value hotel and complimentary drink on arrival! Lovely staff can't do enough for you, will definitely be returning! Thank you

title: Great bar, but so busy
comment: Have been here on a couple of Fridays and I really like the atmosphere and the décor etc, but it really is uncomfortably busy on a Friday! Would like to go on another day when it's a bit calmer because it's a cool place.

title: Nice spot
comment: Came here for a few after dinner drinks on a Friday night and was very happy with the place. The staff are nice, theres a good atmosphere and a good selection of drinks at the bar

title: Beautiful pub restaurant
comment: We had dinner before our anniversary night out. The pub was packed downstairs and restaurant was busy. Really nice decors and good vibes. Food was great, high standard bistro style. Group of us all had a great time there!

title: Cosy Pub
comment: It is very cosy place to go for drink. But at the weekend it is very crowded. If you are searching quite place go for weekdays. Especially employees are ver friendly. They have very good chips and beer selection.

title: Worst dinner I had in a while
comment: WE HAD A TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE at the restaurant upstairs. We paid quite a lot of money for a rather mediocre meal. The apetizer was good but didn't require any cooking (burrata with a bit of pesto on top) and the main was a sad looking dish with beef mixed with chocolate and mashed potatoes on the side. Not only that... they only had three mains on teh menus (one meat based, one fish based and a third vegeterian )!! Which is totally fine, but how can you get them wrong if you only have three (polus the apetizers of course but 90% of them didn't require any actual cooking), so that got me wondering what types of chefs they've got in the kitchen... I think it's one of those places aiming at creating a fancy dinner experience (hence the beef with chocolate) but lacking in the ability to actually do so. The atmosphere is good but nothing special (just another hipster places with a meant-to-be-fancy rough decor). I would definitely recommend avoiding this place for dinner. It's a rip off. The pub downstairs looks nice though, and perhaps also the food isdecent (you can't really go wring with a burger), but I haven't checked the prices...  In conclusion just to be on the safe side and mainly to boicot these London restaurateurs who don't even try to provide a decent service and treat customers like a bunch of fool cashcows - AVOID THIS PLACE

title: Fantastic Sunday roast
comment: Have been here twice in the last few weeks and can whole heartedly recommend it for Sunday roast. The beef comes perfectly cooked on a large platter along with excellent Yorkshire puddings and lots of lovely roast vegetables. We had roast potatoes on one visit and what I would describe as roasted dauphinoise potatoes on the other: both perfectly cooked. You can order the beef in 100g portions which means it's perfect for all...depending on how hungry you are. They vary the roasts that are the alternative so sometimes chicken and other times pork. Both great alternatives. The staff were excellent and very accomodating and the price fair. The only thing I would note is that on both occasions we sat upstairs where the accoustics are far better than downstairs especially if you are looking for group conversation.  We will be going back again soon!

title: Great Pub with Homemade Food
comment: A lovely friendly pub in Whitechapel serving a good range of wines and home made food and snacks. There is table service id you're eating and dinner is served from six pm.

title: Great selection of Gins
comment: We went here for a pre-dinner drink. Excellent atmosphere and a great selection of Gins. Although the bar was busy, were were served very quickly- the bar staff are very good. It's not cheap but it is good!

title: Mediocre would be the most positive way to describe the Sunday Roast.
comment: Nice place and a very tasty cider. Good service and friendly staff. Having read some reviews on how wonderful the Sunday Roast is we were sorely disappointed. £16 for a main/roast for that was poor value. We won't return to eat.

title: Best sunday roast in London
comment: We had one of the best Sunday roasts at the Culpepper. The food was delicious and all ingredients were very fresh. The atmosphere of the restaurant is great as well as the decoration.

title: Yummy Saturday lunch and great upbeat atmosphere
comment: We went for a late lunch toward the end of service on Saturday, we were a party of 10 in the bar area downstairs, despite being fairly busy we were served quickly and the food was really tasty. We stayed on for drinks afterwards until around 11pm when the lighting is dimmed and the bar is lively. Great fun place to go for casual drinks.

title: Lovely pub
comment: Lovely looking pub, great cocktails, great food menu, great atmosphere. Would definitely go back very soon!

title: Mid Week
comment: The atmosphere here is really good and the staff upstairs really engaging making the experience in dinning very good. The food was not up to that high standard we had medallions of beef for 5. The beef was inconsistent and on the light side for the five that were served, the vegetables were limited and the cabbage served was nice in presentation but not so appealing to taste. But we would thank the restaurant for the service and attention paid during the meal.

title: Great food, great service, great Pub!
comment: Stayed for two nights with my husband, booked the greenhouse for a surprise Birthday dinner! The food was amazing, staff happy to please, lovely rooms and a real ‘gem’ of a pub. We will definitely be back.

title: Loved it
comment: The place is Central location, open late and good variety of drinks. Downside is how crowded it gets at late nights meaning you have to stand outside and get herded behind a blue line to avoid inconveniencing passers-by! But over all very nice place

title: All round excellence
comment: We drank, ate and stayed the night in this wonderfully designed establishment. We cannot fault the Culpepper in any area from concept, service, value, vibe and atmosphere . Everything from the quality and unique nature of the menu (and the cocktails menu!!), the staff, the design and the whole feel of the place was wonderful. It is so refreshing to venture into Shoreditch 'hipster' land and find a total lack of pretension and get excellent food and service without feeling ripped off. Please keep it just as it is!

title: Very average
comment: Really don't understand how this place is getting the reviews it does. Very mediocre food, not very generous portions. Did just enough not to get a complaint on the day. flat beer, small amount of chicken on plate dissapointing

title: Best fish and chips! Great pub atmosphere!
comment: Was the best fish and chips I've had so far! Absolutely loved it I could have licked my plate clean. Pub was excellent vibe with plenty of beers on tap. Busy but didn't have to wait too long for a table at all.

title: Won't be back
comment: Me and my wife had lunch in the culpeper after a visit to spitalfields market, on the board outside Sunday roast was advertised so we went in and chose the beef, we were then told the price of your meal was based on beef being £11 per 100grams but we could only have either 350 or400g portion this must be the most bizarre way of pricing a meal ever, when our meals came they looked nothing like a traditional roast dinner...no mash but a square of potato gratin, a hollow Yorkshire pudding and a mix of non descriptive vegetables the only plus side the beef was excellent...In total it cost £44 for 2dinners plus £5 for 2 small cokes plus £6.13 service charge they don't tell you about, If your looking for a reasonable priced traditional Sunday roast dinner then keep well away from the culpeper

title: Good Xmas Dinner
comment: Service and atmosphere was excellent but the set Xmas dinner was overpriced. Would rather have paid less and had an edible quantity, than have so much food go to waste. Food itself was good but nothing special.

title: Great beer, food and atmosphere
comment: A funky London boozer that offers great local ales and fab food. We visited here on numerous occasions during our stay in the square mile and it never disappointed. Always busy and with a great atmosphere, the food beer, food and service were all exceptional. Highly recommend.

title: Rooftop with skyline view!
comment: I loved this place! They have a good range of local beers and friendly staff! The pub itself is very beautiful with vintage furniture and a lot of plants. Very cozy. Usually the pub is very crowded. The highlight of this bar is the awesome rooftop! Its a nice little rooftop with a small bar and a large grill on it. In summer you can enjoy some drinks and a delicious meal up there and enjoy the view! The food was awesome. I would come back anytime!

title: 4 Beautiful Rooms - a little gem of a place !
comment: The Culpeper Rooms are a real treat - cosy - so comfortable - a home from home ! 2 min walk from Aldgate East the Culpeper is well positioned. When I arrived I was greeted with a FREE first drink from the bar and 10% off food and drink thereafter - just show your Key.  There's a separate entrance so you don't have to walk through the bar - and the rooms are through a door on the top floor so you're not disturbed by the laughter in the bar. I had an early night and slept so soundly from 9:30 till 7:00 fantastic and needed ! With a coffee machine free sparkling and still water in the room I felt treated !  Breakfast is included but I didn't want to get out of bed so I missed it - but next time !!!  It's a walk upstairs no lift just for the lazy readers but there's an offer to carry your bags - if needed.  Don't be put off because these rooms are over a bar - it's a great place and worth a try ! LOVE IT x

title: Lovely pub!
comment: Really enjoyed coming into here recently for a pre-dinner-pint. Exactly what one would expect for the area, and it ticked the boxes. cheers!

title: All suit. No trousers.
comment: 3 friends having a mid evening meal. Total cost with wine: £191. The venue and decor are trendy. If this was a highlights show then we'd be soft focusing on the exposed brickwork and trendy lighting.  But it's not a highlights show - it's a place that's supposed to serve good wine and food & this is where the problems start.  We shared a rump steak for 2 - one portion was inedible with gristle. The Rosso Italian was of the 3-Euro-at-the-vinyard variety, so paying £44 for a below average tipple was disappointing.  The culinary highlight was the beetroot starter which was tasty and original - so some hope remains - but not for me. I'll not be back.

title: Superb
comment: Wonderful restaurant. We had a drink in the pub downstairs first; excellent margaritas, very good selection of craft ales and friendly staff – a good start. Dinner in the restaurant was superb. The choices were limited to four starters and four mains but it was varied and between the five of us we tried a lot of different dishes, each one was delicious. I didn’t study the wine list too closely but found a very good Rose for £22. The atmosphere was laid back and friendly, the staff were very attentive but not intrusive, all in all a great night out. Will definitely return.

title: Nice Pub with no tourists and good pale ale
comment: We found this pub by pure chance while rambling around Spitalfields and the brick lane. The pub is really nicely done up. We tasted several different types of beer and loved the pale ale. It was such a good place that we came back another night. We will definitely visit the Culpeper when we are back in london.

title: Good food, relaxed style
comment: Evening food with a friend. They had a special rump steak on offer which we both had and was excellent. Good selection of wine and beer. We ate in the upstairs restaurant. Downstairs is generally rammed especially on Fridays when we ate. One of the better pubs in the area. Decent puddings too. Friendly laid back service.

title: Rude staff
comment: I came in for lunch, kitchen was almost closing and I asked one of the guys if I could quickly order, they aloud me to do that but I think they might have been in rush because I had only a big grumpy face and rude attitude. I understand that kitchen was almost close but rather than have an awful service I preferred not to be seated at all.

title: NFL Weekend Dinner Treat
comment: Wow!!! Second visit here, this time for dinner. Ignore the negative reviews, the food here is amazing. Fresh locally sourced produce cooked to perfection, knowledgeable attentive staff, great cool atmosphere, a brilliant place to eat, loved it and my other half has not stopped raving absolutely the quality. Definitely recommend this place and will be returning soon

title: Excellent cuisine
comment: Saturday evening meal out. The bar was buzzing. The restaurant full but not cramped. Great atmosphere. Food and wine were excellent. Friendly helpful staff who know their stuff. Would highly recommend this pub/restaurant

title: Excellent restaurant
comment: An amazing atmosphere. Arrived late from flight from Mexico, so had to share others' 'nibbles': excellent. Had fried fish and chips. The best I have ever tasted! The batter: well, it could have been a dish on its own!! Amazing! Culpeper is incredibly accessible (even from Heathrow!): just a couple of minutes from Aldgate East underground

title: Credit to the lovely staff at the Culpeper, a place full of character and charm.
comment: Visited today for lunch with my brother. We choose an onion and cheese tart for starters and was disappointed to find the puff pastry was virtually inedible and the melted cheese sauce topping was very salty and was not to our liking. All credit to the member of staff and the manager who not only apologised and offered us a different starter but gave us complimentary desserts as well as taking the price of the starters off the bill. Our main course of brill with new potatoes and greens was superb. Though the roof top garden area is closed now for the winter we were still shown the area at our request as I'd seen this restaurant advertised in the Times travel magazine and wanted to check it out, as they grow some of their produce there. It was no trouble to the staff member to show us around and in fact he seemed proud to do so. Despite the shaky start we will go back for sure as we feel this place has so much to offer.

title: Busy and great for drinks.
comment: We didn't eat here, although the menu looked good. The Culpeper was our local while we stayed in Whitechapel, and there wasn't a single night that it wasn't busy. They have a great bar with good cocktails on offer, and the pub itself is very pretty. Would definitely recommend for after work drinks or some cheeky pre-dinner G&Ts!

title: Chillin' with a view on the Shard
comment: Be on time when the sun comes out! This beautiful rooftop bar is popular among locals. It is a perfect place to get away from the busy Commercial street and relax.

title: Lunch in the sunshine!
comment: Caught up with friends here during a recent trip to London. They are locals and seemed to have plenty of good things about this place, I'm not surprised, it was excellent!! We had food and drinks in the rooftop garden and it was devine, granted the amazing sunshine and fabulous view added to the experience. The menu was quite limited but we all found something, I had the mackerel with a house salad and it was delicious. The others had lamb and salad which they said was great. I had wine but a couple had cocktails and they looked lovely. It's a very relaxed vibe and this is reflected in the attitudes of staff, which I found quite refreshing, although some may be frustrated by this. The menu downstairs had a lot more variety although if you eat here you loose the charm of the garden. Highly recommended!!!

title: A great mix of pub an restaurant with a bonus on the roof.
comment: This is an East-end pub that has been brought forward in a sympathetic way and without losing its charm.  Decor gives a real glimpse of its past.  Good selection of ales, wines and spirits.  Staff very effective and with real personality. They know their products and provide great service.  The restaurants don't take bookings, and can be very popular but it's a nice wait in the bar.  The first floor restaurant has a small menu, but one where I was happy to choose every dish. All cooked to order and good quality. The rooftop is entered through a greenhouse with their own grown produce. There was no space to eat there when I visited but it sure smelled good and worth a walk up to see the terrace.  The fact that the place is full every time have visited speaks volumes to me

title: Terrific evening out!
comment: Pre dinner drinks in buzzy, vibrant surroundings but with attentive staff clearing glasses as soon as people left, wiping tables and keeping clean. Then upstairs to dinner and wow! Charming, enthusiastic staff who know their wines, understand the menu and can explain things beautifully. I had the rabbit casserole on white beans cooked with herbs and greens - it was totally delicious.! Compliments to the chef!

title: Great efficient business lunch - spot on
comment: First visit here in some time but as impressed as ever. Great service - friendly welcome and a lovely table set aside having booked early.  The Wild Goose ale is very tasty and went well with the exotic beetroot, carrot and cow's curd Middle Eastern salad.  For the main we shared the incredible beef - beautifully cooked and succulent with perfect vegetable and anya potato accompaniment. From previous experience I knew to sample a glass of the "Ink" red wine.  Couldn't miss dessert - a beautiful chocolate fondant with white cheese sorbet.  Extravagant and interesting food combinations but served without fuss or pretension. Everyone I have taken here has gone back under their own steam and I am sure today will provide the same!

title: Poor food and service
comment: Booked a table for a 1pm Sunday roast, at 2pm we had still not revived our food. We spoke to the manager who went to the kitchen and found our order. The food was horrible (see pic) the pork was under cooked, gravy was weak with the consistency of water the carrot and roast potato were cold and raw in the middle an absolute disgrace. Avoid much better places to eat on commercial street looking for a Sunday roast go to the Water Poet round the corner much better for a lower price.

title: Average and overpriced
comment: We popped in for a Sunday roast the menu was limited no roast Chicken, Lamb, Beef or veg option just pork, poorly executed, small portion of red cabbage and a whole carrot no other veg very average food for your money, drinks are ok and service is attentive. Would avoid try the Well and Bucket or Galvins same price and never fails.

title: Extremely overpriced and disappointing food
comment: Awful experience - Only couple of choices. Chose the Roast Beef. The waitress was telling me that the smallest portion is 300g but missed to inform me that they charge £11/100g beef!!! No price on menu. There might have been small print but who reads small prints on a menu for prices - roasts are not normally priced this way in pubs and you would expect them to be around £15-20 in pubs. We actually got the bill before getting the food because we got there late and the rest of our party was finishing up. So I saw £33 on the bill - went and complained and asked if I could get a smaller portion than 300g as I was shocked by the price in a pub like this. Its a simple pub after all. They did nothing about my request and served the food anyways 20 minutes later. I was also not asked how I liked my beef - and was served quite rare that I do not like. I did not send it back because by then I was starving. In addition I was asking the waitress when I was ordering what the side is and if it was Yorkshire pudding and I was telling her that I can not eat gluten. She said it was a kind of roast potato - I said that is fine. However, she still served up a Yorkshire pudding with my meal. The meal was blend on top of everything. I paid a high price for a less than average meal. On top of everything, after expressing that I was not happy the waitress kept staring at me with a sarcastic smile on her face the whole time I spent there. She also asked whether I liked the meal - I answered honestly that no I did not like it at all - she did absolutely nothing about it. The worst experience I ever had in any establishment where I left my money and was supposed to get a service for it! I could rate 0 if I could.

title: Posh nosh
comment: Nice and friendly pub style. But don't expect pub food or prices. It's a little expensive but the food is very good and I definitely go back. My only gripe would be the menu is a little short on choice.

title: Great Sunday roast.
comment: Must try sunday roast there. It was great, I'm not a big fan of roast potato but they've done their potato in a very special way and it was delicious. Very attentive service, but there was no pressure of taking order and some annoying 1.5/2 hours table policy which a lot of restaurants do these days. Our friends brought their 15 months baby. The waiter serve us was very patient and did not rush us while we eating, chatting and trying to feed baby and tidy up baby's mess. He did not harass us in anyway or annoyed by the food the baby dropped on the floor. It's a great pub to hang out with friends/families in the weekend. Pretty roof garden to enjoy the sunshine too.

title: highly recommend
comment: This place is always packed on a weekend and there is indeed a reason for this. This pub is an authentic London/Shoreditch experience. Great variety of drinks. The coffee is amazing as well. Perfect for a lazy Sunday afternoon chill.

title: Sardines in the sunshine
comment: Our friends had chosen the Culpeper as a base for a birthday celebration weekend and what a fabulous experience it turned out to be. Starting with lunch on the roof top terrace, to a delicious evening meal in the main restaurant, lovely room with the shabby chic décor, bar with a tremendous range of beers, wines and cocktails, excellent breakfast on the Sunday morning and exceptional customer service from our host Lauren. Made for a superb experience, highly recommended.

title: E1's best Sunday lunch
comment: I never thought anyone could beat my husband's gargantuan Yorkshire puddings until now.  Well done Culpeper chef you delivered on all levels to an extremely picky crowd. You even prepared a full pescetarian roast dinner.  Thank you so much for giving that extra effort, it is so appreciated. We had a fantastic time: fabulous food, easy atmosphere topped off with cocktails on your beautiful, fully functional allotment roof top over looking E1's most famous sights.  Whatever you're doing - keep doing it; it works We left feeling very happy.

title: Almost as good as it gets
comment: This is a restaurant above an amazing London pub. It represents everything I miss about living in London: vibrancy, choice, quality and eager and enthusiastic, diverse staff. And that's just the pub on the ground floor. Restaurant busy and also a great atmosphere. Alas, we didn't have a table on the roof garden which would have been even better on a fine summer evening.  Short but varied menu, decent and unusual wine list. Service lacklustre was the only disappointment and the large plaice for two served on the bone did not come with an offer to filet it before serving. Prices fair for London.

title: London weekend
comment: Visited here for Sunday lunch , quirky decor, relaxed atmosphere excellent food and service . Would highly recommend

title: Great
comment: Nice place. Open till very late hours also during workdays. Very kind service. Lots of different alcohols - strong and good beer of course

title: Exceeded Expectations!
comment: Four of us just spent a birthday week end based around The Culpeper! We wanted a base to explore Shoreditch and chose The Culpeper as it seemed to tick all the boxes. The bedrooms although not huge were spotlessly clean and comfortable. The bathrooms although small had a walk in shower and again spotlessly clean. Of course, there is traffic noise from the road but that is what we expected when we chose to stay on Commercial Road! The staff were all friendly, helpful and professional. We had drinks and tapas on the rooftop terrace for lunch. The space isn't huge but it has been well thought out and is a very relaxing area. The pub is a great base for exploring Spitalfields Market, the various bars around Shoreditch and the vintage shops. Not to mention Colombia Road market.  We had dinner in the restaurant. Although only 3 choices for each with lemon sole and steak to share as extra dishes there was plenty of choice for everyone. The waiting staff were helpful and gave us great recommendations for the food and wine. All which were spot on. The food was beautifully cooked and we all enjoyed our meal not one gripe!  The bar downstairs although busy wasn't too loud for a Saturday night. Plus there were plenty of seats. Drinks were all very reasonably priced. Breakfast was included in the price of the room and was delicious, lovely ingredients and all very well cooked.  The staff went out of their way to be helpful with lots of extra touches, nothing was too much trouble for them. The whole stay was excellent and this was in part to the staff and the venue as a whole. I cannot recommend it enough for a stay in London. It ticks all the boxes, trendy vibe but comfortable and relaxed. It exceeded all our expectations.

title: English Sunday Dinner required !!
comment: Friendly hostess; we had to book as it was busy; so strolled around for an hour; not a problem. The beef was excellent !!! I would've preferred more vegetables, &, as we shared the beef we had the 'pomme Anna chips' :- I would've preferred the roasties that came with the pork option :- The Ribiera del Duero red wine was excellent.  I resent a 12.5 % service charge :- I always reward good service, but don't like this 'system' :- It would definitely put me off returning.

title: Busy
comment: Designers idea of an "Old London Pub". Its ok just but very overpriced beers and when we went extremely busy.Didn't stay for food, although what I saw of the menu it looked ok but again overpriced.

title: Nice view and green space
comment: You can get a really nice overview around the city, very nice garden and the drinks menu looks attractive, the only " negative" point is that they don't have any non alcoholic drinks in the menu but they created something for us without any trouble!!! Thanks for that guys.

title: Delicious
comment: First floor restaurant not the roof top. Absolutely excellent. Chopped raw beef starter sublime, tender, delicious and perfectly seasoned and spiced with a hint of anchovy to lift it to that special level. Cod for mains with the most amazing Mediterranean fennel side and mash beautifully smooth and just the right amount of buttery creaminess. The cod was succulent, moist with the skin spot on crispy. Friends had desserts which were awesome too. Great light and airy space with plenty of room so you don't feel cramped. Service very attentive and personal. Good timing between courses so no hesitation giving it the 5/5

title: Mediterranean brunch
comment: Went to the Culpeper to try out the rooftop garden but unfortunately it was full which isn't surprising go en the weather. Downstairs in the pub was nice and we ordered the house cured salmon and some olives. The salmon was great however the olives tasted a bit funny. We asked the waiter to try and he didn't seem to think it was unusual. Wouldn't recommend them. The Culpeper juice was quite nice orange and grapefruit blend. Overall very nice pub.

title: Overrated
comment: No idea why people rave about this place. It's an average pub. That's it. Just putting 'gastro' in front of the word 'pub' does not make a place special. Went there for Sunday lunch - half the menu was off by 4pm. Enough said.

title: Not bad at all
comment: Nice little pub, good selection of beers, cocktails and wine, food is very good just a little over priced in comparison to other local pubs, always busy with a fun atmosphere

title: Brilliant pub with bedrooms
comment: Very much an old East End London pub but with a modern slant. Culpeper incorporates great atmosphere , good ales and excellent food .We stayed over two nights and it was faultless. Comfortable bed small but spotless bathroom, helpful very friendly staff , nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was a joy , taken on the sunlit herb filled roof garden . Best full English my partner had ever eaten and my perfectly scrambled eggs and home cured salmon was delicious. Yes its a busy traffic junction but earplugs make it possible to sleep with the window open. We would thoroughly recommend and its only a few minutes walk from Aldgate east tube. or, walk the surrounding streets and discover many wonderful sights.

title: Unique and memorable
comment: We spent three nights here whilst visiting London. The location is excellent for easy access to whatever you choose to do/places to visit, and has easy access to the underground (Aldgate East)  This is a unique place to stay, not your standard chain hotel, the rooms are comfortable, looking as though a coat of paint wouldn’t hurt in a shabby-sometimes-chic style. Our room (No.3) had a super comfortable bed, well equipped bathroom with high quality power shower. The downside in the room was that the top quality coffee maker, made a lousy cup of tea – a kettle would have been a more adaptable addition. Having read about noise from the busy streets, we used our well-travelled ear plugs and had 3 really good nights sleep, leaving the windows open. This is a busy and vibrant property, and again having read some negative reviews about the cost of drinks and food, let’s get it into perspective. First of all, this is London. Once you’ve got that, the choice of drinks was good, the food in the bar was high quality and not like your average gastro/pub grub.  The food in the restaurant was at an entirely different level, delicious and memorable, and credit has to go to the Head Chef and his staff for high quality produce, a lot from the roof garden, and has a wonderful ambience, with excellent service throughout. You need to book to get a table. To give you an idea of costs, on our last evening there were four of us for a meal in the restaurant. We all had starters, mains, desserts. We had two bottles of wine, coffee and liqueurs and our bill equated to £45 a head. That was good value for money anywhere. If want to visit Culpeper, just note that this is mobility accessible at bar level, but not in the restaurant or bedrooms.

title: Roof Garden is Tops!
comment: Roof Garden is a great end to any day in London. They have a great menu and their staff is friendly.

title: Great food, great place - try it!
comment: Birthday dinner for four - we covered the menu between us, as it has a short range of choices (which I think is usually a good indicator of quality). I had ray wings, which was a first for me, and they were beautiful. My wife had the vegetarian option and my daughter and her partner had the pork. All (extremely) good. Top notch puds, top notch wines, top notch service and it is simply a very nice place to eat. We had a couple of drinks downstairs in the pub first, which was really buzzing. The restaurant is fairly small, so make sure you book ahead - it's worth it.

title: Expensive beer, kitchen closed, no smoking
comment: This pub is gorgeous to look at, great decor with lots of plants, as well as interesting windows and lights. The beer was expensive downstairs... £12 for two pints - umm .... It's just beer. The food I'm sure is also amazing, though we didn't get that far because the kitchen closes at 6 ... The rooftop is gorgeous, although you have to put your name on a list as it has a tendency to "fill up" - that said, after we had waited and enjoyed a delicious but superoverpriced beer we went upstairs only to realise there were many tables free and they still weren't letting people up. Also note you cannot smoke upstairs on the roof which was a bummer.  But hey if you have a taste for the finer things this might be your perfect local.

title: Wonderful fusion of flavours
comment: This was a restaurant above a pub I found in the Guardian newspaper review. The place was noisy and jam packed but the restaurant an oasis of calm. The service was impeccable and the menu imaginative. Would highly recommend a visit here. Close to Spitalfields market. Reservations a must for this popular restaurant.

title: Great place & delicious food!
comment: Three of us went there on a Friday evening, had some drinks at the ground floor bar and then moved up to the first floor for dinner. The atmosphere at the bar downstairs is great, buzzing but not too loud so we have a conversation without having to shout. The food upstairs was very tasty and we got served this lovely, fresh bread and butter that both felt homemade. We had an excellent bottle of wine to go with our food. The service was very good and the staff friendly. Will definitely return.

title: Beyond expectations
comment: We discovered this little gem while following Ottolengi on Instagram where he recommended it. As you can imagine we set off for lunch with high expectations. We were not disappointed.  The food, all natural with plenty of ingredients from the roof top garden, was innovative and absolutely delicious. The combinations of flavours, colours and textures were a sheer delight to all the senses especially the taste buds.  The service was also outstanding. Energetic people with a clear passion for food. They we very friendly, efficient and knowledgeable about the food. This enhanced the whole experience from the moment we entered the door.  The venue is interesting combining the best of an old pub with the latest trends in contemporary dining trends.  The selection of natural wines and beer and the way they were presented rounded of the whole experience of the most delightful Sunday lunch.

title: Perfect location for a lazy summer lunch
comment: Great food, great service and an eye for detail severely lacking in most city establishments. Started with the steak tartare as recommended by my host and although I have always believed I wouldn't like it, it was an absolute dream! The staff were friendly, knowledgeable about the menu and the wines on offer, and extremely professional. Let's hope more of our forgotten drinking establishments receive a similar makeover.

title: Good Food but Stingy on the Roast
comment: There were four of us that went for Sunday roast. While the food was very tasty they brought it all out on a sharing plate which was annoying, but that is just a personal preference. They also didn't bring near enough of the actual veggies etc for the roast. They brought 3 roast potatoes for four people to share, not even close to enough veg for all of us. We had to ask for more potatoes and veg. I just think it's a lack of common sense that if there are four people each person should at least get their own potato. Not sure I would go back because I just didn't like how they presented it all but the food was good, can't fault them on that!

title: How do you mess up a full English breakfast?
comment: The staff, service and decor are all fabulous, it's just a shame the food is disgusting. I had the full English breakfast. The bacon looked anaemic and was more fat that meat. The sausage was pink and so overly flavoured it was horrible. The mushrooms were *so* salty my throat hurt after eating them. The toast was more like French toast - completely dry and crumbly, and pretty useless for mopping up fried tomatoes and scrambled eggs (the only two things on my plate that were actually nice). Even the butter was overly salted. They need to scrap the entire dish and go back to the drawing board with new ingredients and new recipes. I don't like complaining, and I reiterate the staff were brilliant - it's an incredibly friendly and laid back place, but the food massively lets it down.

title: Great bar with food
comment: I took my dad here for an early Fathers Day brunch. The staff were friendly and looked after me and my lovely old dad well.  We were in the ground floor bar which was lovely and light and airy due to the full length windows and high ceilings. There was a great ambience. It was pretty quiet when we were there so it was easy to chat - don't know how the acoustics would be on a busier time.  I would definately want to try out the first floor restaurant and the roof terrace at some point too. The brunch we had was great - tasty, nicely cooked and some rather delicious bread too. Next time it'll be the lunch or dinner menu and a cocktail or two!

title: Good quality meal in comfortable setting
comment: This restaurant is a nice blend of fine dining in a pub setting. Mid-range prices with a good selection of french wines and a very knowledgeable waiter. We ordered the steak sharer meal, which had very impressive flavouring. Highly recommended.

title: 9 hour lunch
comment: Fabulous E1 spot. Lovely summer lunch. Great that you get 3-4 options, and that they cook them perfectly. Plus loved the seafood bias, great service and quirky wine list.  Stayed on first in the rooftop garden - tranquil and cool. Then rest of the evening in the buzzing pub. A new favourite.

title: Great for cocktails as well as beer...
comment: I live down the road from this place so have been visiting it since I moved in. Sometimes, I feel it such a shame to use a typical East End vibe to describe that place and in many ways this has it. But with a little more class hence the glowing review :) I like a nice boozer and this ticks the boxes but I love the quirks and charms of this place, the exposed walls, the distressed decor, the rustic charm and tid bits of the way they serve their bites and drinks. It actually makes the place 'sticky' in the sense that it's very comfortable. I prefer it when it's quieter than it's busy, but that's me being selfish as I quite like to have a drink here and work on Fridays just before the after work party arrives. A little off the beaten track, but only slightly and absolutely worth the effort to find!

title: Impressive
comment: Impressive gastro pub. The food is nicely done here. I had clams and mussels for a starter, and extremely tasty it was too. I had the Ray for main. Bit of a speculative choice on my part. It was ok but short of excellent. I wished I'd ordered the pork which looked very nice indeed (confirmed as excellent by my companions). The mess for dessert was lovely. I found the wine list short on new world options, but I would say that. Service was good. Very pleasant, although the food was a tad slow to come out. Prices were fine. All in all, we like it, most satisfactory.

title: Modern twist on pub food
comment: Thoroughly enjoyed our Sunday Roast here. My daughter had the beef and I had the chicken. Well presented and tasty. A tad expensive. Do try if you are in the area. Well patronised place and in an interesting neighbourhood which all visitors to London should come to for a look-see.

title: In a league of its own
comment: We came here after checking in at the hotel down the road on Tuesday 24 May 2016 for some lunch and a drink (or 5). For a Tuesday this place had a great vibe. It definitely filled up with the after work crowd, and when we returned on Friday and Saturday night, it was equally busy. That being said, the bar staff are very attentive so you will not struggle to get to the bar and get a drink. This place could hold its own in Melbourne, Australia.  The Culpeper is four levels. The ground floor is a pub vibe with lots of natural light from the full length windows. On this level they serve a good but short selection of food (some of which is on the menu upstairs in the restaurant). From this menu, we had the gnocchi and the pork pie. Both will not disappoint and you will not walk away hungry or breaking the bank!  The first floor is the restaurant. It's limited seating, at least from where we could see, so I'd say bookings would be essential. The food was outstanding. They have a great selection of seafood and it has a great Italian flavor to it. We had the meat platter for starters and there was a special of whole sole for a main. We ended up skipping dessert as we were full. My partner is still raving about the meal!  The second floor has rooms you can book to stay in. And then there is the rooftop which has its own separate grill based menu. The views are amazing, but we didn't get a chance to eat here.  The staff were amazingly attentive, friendly, and were more than happy to tell us about the area and point us in the direction of the Spitalfields Markets, Brick lane.  In all honesty, if we had known about this place when we were booking a hotel, we'd have stayed here as the rooms look amazing and come with breakfast. Next time we venture from Australia to London we will definitely be staying at the Culpeper.

title: Fantastic staff, good food, good atmosphere
comment: I wanted to thank the staff of The Culpeper for their excellent response to the disaster wreaked by the idiot next to me. We had just finished delicious starters (pork rillettes and cornichons, hummus salad and flatbreads) and were looking forward to our main courses, when a bloke wearing a backpack tried to sit at the table next to us. The spaces between tables is small, as in most London restaurants - unfortunately we didn't notice him until he had knocked both of our glasses of red wine and the rest of the bottle into my lap. His response was "sorry" and sat down fully intending to eat at the table next to me. He seemed to think it unreasonable of me not to want him to sit next to me and enjoy the meal he had prevented me from eating. It wasn't possible to stay - I was literally sitting in a whole bottle of red wine.  The staff were superb, calm, reassuring, brought me wet cloths and even wine stain remover to clean up (which had no chance of working given the amount spilt, but a thoughtful response).  What I hadn't realised until later as I went back to our hotel nearby and left my husband to pay was that they had waived our bill - not necessary, as it wasn't their fault, but a nice gesture.  And to the idiot who ruined both our evening and my clothes, if you must wear a back pack in London, even if you are one of those people who doesn't take them down in the tube, at least do so when you are squeezing into a restaurant table. And there are some "mistakes" as you called it, that "sorry" really isn't an adequate response for.

title: Dinner date with a friend
comment: Great catch up, buzzing atmosphere and attentive bar staff (even during peak time 5-8) followed by an amazing 3 corse meal upstairs. Very happy and will definitely be going again soon! Manager (Josh) was a supper friendly guy to talk to! Good man!!

title: The culpepper
comment: A very lively restaurant in a youthful area of London. Upstairs is quite nice but the decor needs an update. The food while pricey is average and the service was quite good. I had the fish and roast combination and it did not raise the bar for prices charged. I would probably not make this a choice spot on a return visit. I think the bar downstairs is a better choice for a drop in visit.

title: fun
comment: this bar is great! absolutely fun. The best restaurant/bar to go to when in the area by far. its fairly close to Aldgate East station and a reasonable walk to the city and brick lane. its in the city without really being IN the city, or not being too far out. I always got on well with the staff and quite enjoyed the friendliness of two of the bartenders, Timoté, the French bartender and Ruta the Lithuanian bartender. its always a pleasure to visit this place and i would 100% recommend it to anyone looking for good food and chilled drinks in the area. if you arrive in the area and are looking for good lunch or dinner with a great vibe and friendly service then i dont recommend looking further than the Culpeper.

title: Wonderfully presented Sunday roast😆
comment: I've always wanted to visit The Culpeper and when I finally had the opportunity I wasn't disappointed. We had Sunday roasts both a sharing beef and a sharing pork. The presentation was impressive and really showed off britsh cuisine for our American guests we were taking round london. The quality was really good and so was flavour. If you do go on a Sunday don't pick something else on the menu because you will have food envy if you don't have a roast. Service was extremely good also. I'd definitely recommend as a dinner venue and i'm sure I'll go back as we were all very satisfied and smug after eating our dinners.

title: Explosion of flavors
comment: We had dinner in the dining room (situated on the second floor). The first floor is reserved for tapas and drinks. The menu was small but adequate. Dishes were delicious and super tasteful. Service was impeccable. The price is on the higher side for the portion size.

title: Local beers
comment: Walked in here for a drink after a Sunday night dinner in the neighbourhood. We were impressed both by the looks and the space of the place (it was of course Sunday night, so not too busy). Also happy with the large amount of locally brewed beers we could choose from, in addition to draughts. The staff was very friendly. The food menu looked great too, although we obviously did not try it out.

title: Something quite special
comment: Great food, great service, great vibe. 3 of us booked a table here last minute and ended up eating one of the best meals we've had in a gastro-pub. I'd call it more french bistro than pub. The sharing mains are awesome - we shared 750g of rump steak which was tender and perfectly cooked, which came with bbq'd cabbage, and potato fried blocks (see pic), gravy, mushroom and blue cheese. Absolutely delicious. Fantastic selection of craft beers, and great wine list (Ciu Ciu, £24) The front of house was great, and make sure you try the freshly baked gooey cookies at the end.

title: Disappointing
comment: We planned to come here for a Sunday roast and sit on the rooftop which we had heard about before. Unfortunately the rooftop has a different menu, more like a BBQ and you are not able to get a roast. This was fine though, we decided we would try it out up there anyway. We gave a phone number to the waitress who said she would text us when a table became available; that it would be up to an hour's wait.  Eventually over 80minutes later and starving we got a text message so headed back and up to the rooftop. We had to put together a table with the right amount of chairs for us ourselves which wouldn't normally be a problem but when you've already waited for so long you kind of expect them to have a table ready for you. We sat down and looked at the chalkboard menu next to our table. On the menu was about 4 different meats and then a vegetable section with choices of asparagus, potato salad, peppers, salads and then a choice of sauces too. The waiter came to take our order and pretty much everything we wanted, they had run out of. He said that we should be looking at the other menu at the other end of the roof because there was more available from that one. I normally expect to be told what is unavailable before it gets to the stage where you are ordering. In the end we all found some things to order.  In the meantime our drinks arrived and two of them were not what we had ordered. Then the food came. Between us, 4 of us had ordered the peppers. 4 halves of 2 peppers arrived with anchovies on them (this should said on the menu because one of our group was a vegetarian so then couldn't eat them). The waiter said that this plate was 2 portions. We waited another few minutes and then asked a different waiter if any more food was coming because we were still waiting for two peppers. He said he was sorry he had forgotten to tell us that they ran out of peppers halfway through cooking. My friend's sauce that she ordered also never turned up. I later went to use the toilet and there was no toilet rolls in any of the stalls (again this is not something that would normally bother me too much at all but alongside everything else it was just the icing on the cake)  The food that we had was tasty but portions were small and in my opinion not worth the price. We didn't pay our service charge and someone who I assume was a manager understood this and apologised but I don't think I will be heading back to the rooftop anytime soon.

title: Almost ruined our Saturday afternoon
comment: By one employee. We came to the pub after 12pm and unfortunately all tables on the roof bar were taken. The hostess that was in charge of the roof bar seating said she will take our phone number and gives us a call when there is a free table. We waited about 30 min in downstairs’ bar and then became suspicious because even people that came after us were called for a table at the roof bar. I went upstairs and asked the hostess what is happening. She said she sent us a text but we didn’t turn up. Of course she noted my phone number incorrectly so I asked her to update it (repeated it) and she said she will give us a priority now. I also asked her to come downstairs to give us a shout just in case a text doesn’t work again. There was no apology for taking the number wrong. Waited another 20 min and nothing. Went upstairs again, and hostess said that she sent us a text again (which neither of time I received). She then told me to go upstairs and check if any table is free which I did and luckily there was a table. Again, no apology whatsoever. Her attitude was almost like, oh well, it happened, so what. She also said she came downstairs to look for us which was a lie.  By the time we got to our lunch, they had only 2 main courses available out of 5. After we questioned the hostess what has happened the second time, she said she can’t see our details on the system anymore and can’t say what happened. Only at this point she said sorry which was in our opinion too late. We will definitely not be going back and we won’t recommend the place as she nearly spoiled our Saturday afternoon and it could have been so simple to resolve. The waiter at the roof bar was very good and attentive and the food was good as well.

title: Terrified experience, the worst food I have ever had in the world! definitely never go again!
comment: Terrified experience, the worst food I have ever had in the world! definitely never go again!  We waited for 2 hour for the roof top garden ,  I have ordered a bottle of cider , it comes with two glass of diluted cider with full of iced.  The food were the most terrified things  We ordered 3 main dishes, one lamp chop and one pork and one gilled fish - they were all come with really sightly cooked , extremely small portion in a big empty plate , no source , no veggi, no french fried , nothing . We were very dispointed as the food are completely different for the photos shown on the wedsite with fully dressing.  The fish smelled bad , all the living organs were still stuff inside the fish.  We have ordered a Cabbage, they gilled it badly which turned into black and hard and dry which cant even put into mouth! I would really not recommend anyone to go there and wont never come back again!

title: Good value and convenient
comment: This is a typical pub that one can find in London. I was able to secure a a room for the night. The room was quite nice and included breakfast in the morning. I also had dinner. Dinner had several dining options. The bar, a restaurant on the second floor or a rooftop restaurant that is only open in nice weather. Quite reasonable for London. All staff were friendly and helpful.

title: Great food on a rooftop terrace
comment: Although the menu was simple the food was really good and great value, probably the best asparagus I've ever had. Our visit was slightly spoiled by the receptionist who messed up (twice) getting us a table. Also, they'd run out of a lot of the menu early in the afternoon. Still, it was the first hot day so maybe they needed the practice.

title: Delicious, charming
comment: My husband and I both loved this place, the food and the staff were wonderful! We had late reservations after a tour, and were originally confused when we entered and there were so many people in the main floor lounge area, and we didn't see a hostess or any signs to direct us, but we asked the bartender and were directed up the stairs to the restaurant area. It was quaint, adorable, and cozy. Prices were very reasonable, especially given the quality of food.

title: Nice twist on a pub lunch
comment: Great service from friendly, helpful and accommodating staff. (We were a big group with grandparents, babies and lots of friends and they didn't blink / falter once in the level of service they provided us with. Nice chilled out atmosphere too. The only negatives are that the portions are too small and the prices a little too steep.

title: Great Pub
comment: The pub has a lovely atmosphere and wide selection of ales, it does get very busy and noisy in an evening.

title: Cheeky
comment: A lunchtime visit...my second to the Culpepper and slightly more formal this time. The first time its was beers and light snacks, this time we sampled a fuller set from the menu. Bread served with Anchovy Butter...may sound hmmmm, but really really nice. I sampled a beef cheek pudding with cabbage...absolutely first class. My dining partner went for the pollack, chips and peas and was suitably impressed. A walnut brownie and ice cream was small in stature, but heavy in body...had to share it...as totally stuffed. Good range of beers...Harvey's was particularly tasty and well kept. Service was just right and cost likewise.

title: Great food and attentive staff
comment: Whether you want a semi-formal dining area(on the first floor) or a relaxed lunch or even snack this is the perfect place. The staff are really friendly and attentive. They also know the menu fully. The food is excellent and you know it's fres and freshly prepared as they do not have a huge menu. They offer some superb wines at not over the top prices. I have visited 4 times over the last 4 weeks both evenings and lunchtimes and cannot fault the Culpeper.

title: Amazing rooms - don't go home, fall asleep in their new rooms!
comment: We stayed in their rooms recently (as their first ever guests), and it was awesome. Very cool rooms, with everything you need (comfy bed, great coffee machine, mini-stereo, huge shower), with great decor (we loved the light in our room!). It is a total joy to just go upstairs to bed after a wonderful dinner (the shared rump steak was immmmmense and perfect).  The breakfast was also great - home cured smoked salmon, loads of great coffee, croissants, fruit salad etc. And everyone is super friendly, and seemed happy to be there and to help. If you want a lazy weekend in London, you can't do much wrong by having dinner at Culpeper and then taking one of their rooms. Totally recommend this place. Thank you guys!

title: Good Pub Good Food
comment: The Culpeper has a downstairs pub with a great atmosphere and a decent selection of malt whisky. It serves bar meals also. Upstairs is a very pleasant restaurant with helpful staff. The menu is limited but the quality of food is excellent. I would recommend the asparagus with duck egg and the hake.

title: Very good pub
comment: Very good pub, nicely decorated. They also have a restaurant and a roof terrace which we didn't try due to weather conditions. We tried some food at pub and the fries are to die for! A bit noisy but so is every pub. Well done!

title: Disappointing!
comment: Our Sunday afternoon visit stated well as we were greeted by very friendly staff in a trendy looking pub/restaurant. The fairly basic menu and for me average food was a disappointment.

title: A lovely place for a quick drink after work
comment: Quite limited seating available and perhaps not the best use of space. Lovely drinks menu, friendly staff. we will certainly return for a quick drink after work but would struggle to base ourselves there for a few hours

title: Damn good
comment: Highly polished, well run, efficient bar in trendy part of London. Good beer, loved it. Staff impeccable, friendly atmosphere. Will return soon.

title: Friendly service
comment: Great little spot and very friendly and helpful staff. We made a small pit stop here during a Street Art walking tour in London and enjoyed brunch and a beer.  The menu was not extensive but had very interesting combinations and the staff were very friendly. These is lots of room in this pub and it has quirky features and fixtures with a roof garden. I'll be back.

title: Felt like a local pub, despite its location
comment: Thoroughly enjoyed visiting this city pub. It had friendly and knowledgeable staff, good beer, and it generally felt like a local pub (despite the fact that it is clearly located in a business district). Couldn't really fault it. Would love to visit again, given the chance. That said, I'm glad I didn't eat dinner here - at first glance at least, the prices seemed quite steep.

title: Great pub
comment: Had the most amazing beef pie and chips. The pie had loads of filling. Would highly recommend this pub. Service was pretty good, food is reasonably priced. Will definitely be returning.

title: My favourite pub/bar so far!
comment: Been there many times with friends and few times with my girlfriend. Amazing, warm and stylish place, very good drinks and proffessional, helpful staff. Perfect place to come back to, surrounded with lovely, calming lights and general atmosphere. Particularly good for evening meetings. Recommended.

title: Recommended
comment: Very nice pub/restaurant. Had a great Sunday lunch here (there aren't many places near here that do Sunday lunch, so you need to book in advance). Great beer choices too. They were very helpful and looked after our 88 year old father really well. Much appreciated. Recommended

title: Impressive Pub
comment: This place looks great from the outside, even better once you are in but - even that - does not prepare you to such a delight. Food is impressive, the service is of a very high standard and particularly friendly. This is one of the very top pubs in London.

title: Great!
comment: We've been to Culpeper for meals a couple of times now and have never been disappointed. Fabulous food, wide variety of beer and wine - of which the staff are knowledgable. The staff are amazing, attentive, polite. Would recommend!

title: Lovely, lively pub with great service.
comment: Great little pub with a lively atmosphere. What made our visit memorable however was the service we received.  The hallmark of great customer service is the swift correction of your mistakes. A simple hearing error on the part of the waiter when ordering our food (because the room was so loud and my friend is very softly spoken) resulted in us getting two portions of just chips rather than two portions of fish and chips . The staff quickly corrected the error, brought us a complementary starter and came to check everything was ok during the meal - over and above what you'd normally expect in a busy Saturday night pub.  The food was lovely too. Will definitely return

title: Excellent Quality Food & Atmosphere In A London Pub
comment: This place was recommended but I was sceptical that it could be as good as all that. It's a pub after all. But my scepticism was misplaced. Firstly the decor - from the moment we walked in we were impressed. A well judged and tasteful refurb' of what was once a grotty East End street corner boozer with sticky carpets. This place looks stunning but is still homely and is still very much a pub - albeit a top quality establishment. A look at the ales on offer had me smiling right off. The understated and professional manager (Josh) knows his beer. He helped me to choose a Purity Ales IPA which was superb and well kept. Later he filled me in on the brewer and on the history of the pub. It's run by deeply impressive people - not just a bunch of wealthy show-offs. Upstairs is a quality restaurant with a tempting fine dining menu. If the food is only as good as what they serve in the bar it will be great. Our BLT and fries provided us with a delicious and well presented lunch that stopped short of being pretentious. The olives were also excellent. This, for me, is how to run a gastro-pub. Keep the gastro bit upstairs or in the background and retain a real English pub atmosphere in the bar. Even my non-beer drinking wife agreed. We will be back.

title: Bad bear... Tastes like flowers
comment: The place is nice, regular service but very bad bear, tried another one and its similar so I guess you get nothing better.

title: Lovely place
comment: Very lovely pub that serve great selection of comfortable dishes on the first floor. the bonus is the rooftop terrace when it is sunny.

title: Great lunch for a special occasion
comment: Really enjoyed my trip here as a birthday treat for lunch three weeks ago. Great food and service, really pleasant staff and a relaxed atmosphere. Love the neighbourhood too. Highly recommended.

title: Great bar but need more bar staff on a Saturday night
comment: A great bar, lovely venue, nice atmosphere to meet up with friends. My only suggestion is to employ more bar staff on a Saturday night.

title: Saturday afternoon with Friends
comment: This is a great pub, it's been restored sensitively to retain its charm. I love this place, great atmosphere great friendly staff. Next time we will definitely eat, the menu looks great. Definitely need to book.

title: New Years Eve
comment: What a great night! The Culpeper dos it again and showcased another great friendly evening of fun and festivities. Great warm welcome always from the managers and the bar staff are always happy and great fun. The atmosphere was great and everyone had fun. The only downer was the disco not doing a countdown for midnight but that didn't stop us revellers doing it for them. The free glass of fizz went down very well too! Thank you so much for another amazing night. Worth every penny and more of the £15 !

title: Great in every way
comment: I've been here a few times now and felt compelled to write a review after my last visit. This is such a great pub, a real gem in the area. Good work on the hiring of very friendly, helpful staff - it makes such a difference. The food and atmosphere is great.

title: Great atmosphere and great Sunday Roast
comment: This pub has a great vibe, very lively but cosy. The décor is nice and they have a rooftop that grows vegetables, the view of the city isn't great but you can still see bits and pieces of all the tall buildings. I haven't had any of the other food but the Sunday Roast is divine. Great place to come with friends.

title: Heartty and good
comment: Not a cuisine for the faint-hearted, in terms of seasoning, condiments and general flavours. This is straight and muscular cuisine. But all was pleasant, cooked with dexterity and using good produce. The menu is short, clever and (for me) immensely appealing, with a section of plates for two to share. I was tempted by a starter of burrata with orange and Treviso radicchio but I went instead for duck hearts with Puy lentils. Lovely lentils, perfectly cooked, as was the meat. Very satisfying earthy dish. For main, I went vegetarian, with an interesting cauliflower based dish, slightly salty, but good. A pannacotta to finish was the star of the show: it was just perfect, wobbly and creamy and rightly sweet, the rhubarb and some shortbreads lovely accompaniments. This place reminds me of Brawn in terms of type and level of cuisine: if you like one you're likely to like the other. The room is large and cool. Service by our waitress was smiley, sweet and informed, and there was a similarly pleasant attitude by every other member of the team. Prices are right. A place to return to.

title: neat stop for a beer.
comment: we had been wandering around the interesting and fun shoreditch area. stopped along the way for coffee and croissants. a take way samosa. chocolate. admired the street art. lovely sunny day! stopped here for a beer. filled up quickly for lunch after we arrived. great decor. fun to watch people go by. a popular spot!

title: Afternoon Lunch
comment: Was very impressed with the service and food here. My friend and I came in for a late lunch. We were greeted by very energetic staff, and were helpful in their food and drink choices. We both chose to have the special of the day which was a marmalade bacon sandwich with chips. So tasty. Will definently be back.

title: Great place to hang out
comment: Nice people, good selection of drinks, and a relaxed atmosphere on the weekend. Overall a great place to stop in for a drink or hang out for an evening...

title: great atmosphere, good food and friendly staff
comment: Really great place - Lots of people there and good food. Ideal for a reunion with friends or business meeting.

title: Right in your face bar staff.
comment: I had great expectations upon entering this pub /restaurant during a recent lunchtime break from work. As it was fairly empty apart from a few trendy bearded gents on their laptops I expected prompt service ,but the bar staff didn`t even let me settle before thrusting menus and wine lists under my nostrils. Not cheap for beverages and the toilets are a hike.Felt like I was climbing everest as I`d consumed a Brick Lane madras moments before. My old mate Stan Jacksonville certainly struggled with the stairs but then again he is 76. Strictly for those who are young and want to be seen.

title: Cool Aldgate pub
comment: We just had a sunday roast at the Culpeper. We had a semi private area for the 12 of us. The pub interior is just great. The owners did a great job keeping the restored old bricks wall and brought a touch of modern shabby chic : candles on the walls, simple scandinavian looking wooden furniture, greenery hanging over the table... The pub is just 5 min walk from Aldgate station and was packed on a sunday afternoon. I really liked it and will go again !

title: Sunday roast
comment: Two friends had a fabulous Sunday roast lunch at the Culpeper. Not only are the staff so welcoming and helpful but the food is awesome. They have a rotating menu that changes week to week, as you can see we were on chicken week!  I especially loved the honey glazed carrots :) if you are looking at going to this restaurant make sure you book in advance as this is fully booked out each Sunday!

title: Brilliant Birthday dinner for a large group!
comment: I booked The Culpeper for my boyfriends 30th birthday, there were 16 of us having a three course dinner on a Saturday night. The food & wine were great, and the staff were really friendly and helpful (also when I made the enquiries and booked it).  We stayed and had drinks in the bar downstairs afterwards. It's an impressive looking building too, great for special occasion.

title: It could be excellent... let's see next time...
comment: This is an old East London 'boozer' that's shifted with the times. Right on our doorstep and we've walked past it a few thousand times. Right next to Smithfield market. But it got a good review in The Times. Being pre-Christmas, we couldn't get a booking in the small restaurant on the first floor. So we went along 'on spec' and ate in the Bar. Table service was great. But the bar menu is a bit random and there was really only one 'proper' full meal but as it was battered cod and chips, we were more than happy. The rest of the items were really only bar snacks although you could make your own Culpeper version of Tapas I guess. Will try the restaurant next time and hopefully send out an Excellent review. Quite a few of the clientèle managed to occupy Bar and table space all evening on just one drink but maybe the management is happy with that. Perhaps serving drinks at the table might improve takings?

title: Really nice refurbed old fashioned pub
comment: I haven't eaten here but drank on a few occasions. It's a proper old pub that has been restored lovingly and tastefully. A very good selection of real ales on offer along with a decent wine list. It's not a cheap pint but it is a lovely venue. It also gets heaving with people so get there early Monday to Friday to nab a table or the after work crowd will beat you to it.

title: Fantastic Pub & Restaurant
comment: The kind of people you might meet here is a mix of people that usually work in Shoreditch and Bank... All in their 30s and some 40s. In short words: the kind of people i like to be surrounded when i'm at a Pub. The noise level ever went too high, interior is very modern but not gorgeous: it's somehow minimalistic, but i really liked it. Selection of beer is "ok", but i was really attracted by the wine one: that is really good! After a quick drink we went upstairs at the restaurant: you'd better book as they don't have many tables and it appears to be always full, also during weekdays (and it was on a thursday evening). I'm not surprised: food here is awesome! And the service is courteous, extremely courteous. I'd really recommend to try the "Burrata" as starter. Seems like their chef mixes tastes and ingredients from everywhere in the world (they also have some "Lardo di Colonnata", a rare italian salumi) in quite a delicious way. It's not extremely cheap but you can't pretend their service and the best ingredients to come at a bargain price, honestly. I think i the value for money is good. Last but not least: they are open until late. I'll surely be back to try their sunday roast that i've heard is absolutely delicious.

title: A bar with something about it....
comment: I stopped off here after some food and I'm glad I did. It had a lovely bustling vibe about it, lots of different kinds of people of all shapes and sizes.  An ok beer selection and really friendly staff. Worth a punt* *or Pint ;-)

title: Straight up flavour, like 'Terroirs'
comment: Victorian corner-turning pub - loads of glass - converted to roomy restaurant. For a restaurant atmosphere with attentive waiters go upstairs, for a bar with canteen tables go down. Dishes are mostly a novel or classic mix of 3 to 4 things on a plate, so amazingly tender moist lamb shoulder with beetroot and leaves and capers, or perfect veg with marvellous cheese and great oil. For the first time in a year I went for a vegetarian main, so clearly one for the carnevales. Knowledgeable waiters introduce you to the wines, many of which you won't have seen (often). 10 years ago the guy in the kitchen ran THE cult restaurant in London, Terroirs. This follows on nicely.

title: Great pub/bar attentive staff, good choices
comment: I went here with a girlfriend. We came here previous for a nice Sunday Roast in the pub. They have a restaurant aswell with a different menu. We came for Saturday lunch, it wasn't too busy, it has a nice feel to it, high ceilings, good spec, clean and a nice clientele. We had a very tasty bread & butter, black pudding, pork pie & relish, and soup. Reasonable price and great staff!

title: Don't go here if you expect pub food
comment: We went there hoping for an upscale (or gastropub) experience. On a Friday, the downstairs was packed with people drinking, but apparently no food was being served there.
