The restaurant upstairs had a very, very limited menu, and though we are foodies, we weren't thrilled with the choices. The food was excellent, but the choices so limited that I would return. The cocktails (particularly the Culpeper 75) were excellent.

title: I'm too sexy for my food, too sexy for my food....
comment: Very cool gastro-pub full of mainly bright young 30-somethings. Food was very good but menu is limited for the non-adventurous. Whatever happened to high quality ingredients being prepared in a simple way? Have we become so bored that we now have to push the envelope in every direction of experimentation and mingling of flavours? Personally I could do without sardines in my butter, for example. Service was excellent and the wine was good and reasonably priced. But if you are a fussy eater, you might want to check the menu before you book.

title: Lovely chips!
comment: Dropped in here on Friday afternoon last for bit of lunch with my boyfriend - we were just after checking into ibis hotel up the street! Had a cheddar cheese and pickle sandwich with chips. Toppings on sandwich was a bit scarce but the chips were lovely! Boyfriend found it hard to pick anything from the small and random menu but eventually chanced some sort of pudding balls with chips. Service was good and friendly but can't say I'd be rushing back for food! Nice place for a chill out drink though!!!

title: Trendy British Pub
comment: This is a pub done right. Nice decor, good food including healthy options - was looking for a light snack, and their artichokes hit the spot just right! Was there on a Thursday evening and it was packed - nice place if you're in the neighborhood.

title: Lunch stop
comment: We stopped here randomly to find some tasty food and were initially unsure about the menu items. Luckily, the waiter was very helpful and recommended some dishes. We opted for the pig's head, soup and crab toast. They were all amazingly delicious. We were blown away by the flavours. Coffee was great here too and the anchovies butter with the bread... Another great surprise!

title: Immense
comment: So damn good I can barely stand it. Really excellent food and professional friendly service. Also nice selection of beers and pleasant interior. On the pricey side so probably one for a special occasion

title: Love this pub
comment: Lovely staff, lovely food, great roof terrace (although it is a shame that we can't smoke up there). The Culpepper definitely ranks amongst my favourite pubs in London

title: Disappointing for vegetarians
comment: The Sunday roast looked fantastic but there was a really poor selection for vegetarians which was surprising given their "grow you own" ethos. I had a vegetarian tart which has great ingredients but was just boring and overpriced. The drinks and bar staff were excellent though, and the service was brilliant (v attentive waiters). The roof garden gets very booked up and there is no communication between staff on different floors. We waited nearly two hours for a table upstairs, only to be told on arrival of the garden that there wasn't space (they put you in a virtual queue and text when to come up). After a bit of arguing with a slightly rude member of staff, they let us upstairs. There were at least 4 free tables, but we were told there was wasn't any space. Quite frustrating but the service when we finally got upstairs was excellent- just a shame the experience was so complicated at times. We were happy to wait for a table but it's annoying to get there, be spoken to rudely and discover there were so many tables available!

title: Disappointment turned to delight!
comment: I'd be tempted to start off the review by saying avoid going on a Sunday whilst they're serving roasts. Better communication and clarity on their cluttered website would indicate that the roast isn't served all day and that if you come closer to 6 (when they stop serving the roast) then your options are likely to be limited if a roast is what you had your heart set on.  Sadly this happened to our party of four when we turned up and were told only one choice of roast was available. I think they could see that we were quite annoyed at this as our waitress had summoned the manager who took the blame for the poor communication and then went out of his way to accommodate is food wise.  I must say that despite the food being decent, our visit was made by our amazing waitress Nadia, who kept us laughing the whole way through and also showed off some of her wine knowledge letting us taste different ones until we found one we liked. We ended up having a good meal with a mish mash of different things from the roast menu and the rooftop menu all of which was very tasty.  I'd definitely visit again if I could make sure Nadia would be our waitress and I'll definitely be avoiding a Sunday next time!

title: So reliable
comment: This local is brilliant. We've ate on the recently opened roof terrace, and were in the ground floor bar for lunch last Sunday. Service is brilliant - nothing is a problem, they remember you from your last visit, and are completely attentive without hovering. It's clearly popular as there was a stream of people coming in the whole time we were there desperate for a table. The quality of the food is really high. I love the place.

title: Quick beer on the way
comment: Great location, just beautiful inside, nice staff, unique interior. Relaxed people and atmosphere. We will come back!

title: Absolutely amazing roof experience :)
comment: We went there just for a quick drink and bite, did not realised that there is a roof level too, luckily for us it was too busy downstairs we we kept walking up! Absolutely amazing to sit up there,quieter as no traffic, lovely view too! Friendly staff and great service! I already want to be back!!

title: The best Monkfish Wellington i've ever had
comment: The food was astounding. Random concept, Monkfish Wellington, but it was GORGEOUS.....I'm so tempted to go back there for dinner again tonight. The staff were very attentive (but not over-bearing) and we had a fantastic evening. The gin cocktails are pretty good too! All in, well worth a visit - but then did I really say that? I need to be able to book in future so don't all book at once!

title: Last days of summer
comment: London is great in the sunshine Even better when atop a restaurant garden overlooking the Gherkin Yes a restaurant garden - in Commercial Street - wow I took friends one of which is a chef over from Oz to sit outside on probably one of the last days of this year that could be called summer We had the BBQ menu from the outside grill with salad freshly picked from behind our tables Wonderful  Even the unfiltered wine that once we'ed established was not frozen but lemon squash like when poured was the perfect accompaniment to the French chicken  This is a lovely place and all I hope is the refurbishment of the floors below remain as near to the state they are currently in so that for once the character of the venue matches the food and staff

title: Bright and friendly
comment: Great bar. On the edge of the city and whitechapel, a great contemporary take on a traditional east London boozer. Busy and bright with decent selection of beers. They have a new roof terrace which I would have tried had I not been so knackered after pounding the streets looking for a decent pub not crammed with city types. Only downside is the staff like to let you know it's their pub by finishing off their conversations before serving you.

title: Trendy
comment: Trendy young restaurant, nice interior and very friendly staff. Good quality of food, bit small portions and they might add some more vegetables as they use the roof garden as an attraction.

title: Not half bad..... :-)
comment: My husband and I chose this on pure speculation and location. Our son and his girlfriend live 5mins away and it was a case of "how about The Culpepper?" to meet up with Fran after she finished work. None of us had been here before. The overall impression is Trendy. With a capital T. Exposed brick and plaster, exposed pipework, rough sterling board, old school chairs, mix and match furniture, etc. The typical pub tiles have been restored on the outside, which is a nice touch. Good choice of beers and wines. Friendly staff. Clean. The menu is small and we all chose the same of a tuna salad with some chips to share. We also had a meat plate and a cheesy-anchovy slice of bread. Reasonable value for London, but the area is becoming more popular and so prices are going up accordingly. Quite happy to drop in again - not only for a drink, but also to see if anyone handed my sunglasses in!!

title: Great atmosphere and roof terrace
comment: Came here with a friend as we'd heard about the roof terrace - would recommend booking as we had to wait over and hour to get up there. The view is good, but I haven't been to many terraces so can't compare too much! The terraces is nicely decorated and the grilled food is great - especially the peppers. A bit pricey, but you're on a roof terrace in central London!

title: The Roof Terrace
comment: The Culpepper doesn't cease to surprise on all levels. The roof terrace has only just opened and what a lovely little joyful place it is to relax. A few teething issues but nothing that can't be ironed out along the way. They managed to get us a nice table even though we hadn't booked and we ordered our food. It took a while to come but when it did the starters were worth it. Chunks of lovely sourdough with a rich garlicky tomato topping and some lovely green olives that were fragrant and rich. All washed down with an amazing Italian wine.  The mains came however didn't meet to my expectations. The corn fed chicken was a large portion but could have done with another 10 minutes I feel on the bbq and the potato salad whilst fresh was slightly undercooked also. The hero of the night was the roasted peppers and the sausage which was fab but the sausage was slightly cold.  All in all we still had a great time and enjoyed the experience and I am sure when we visit again the food will reflect The Culpepers other levels as I am sure it's just a few teething issues on the teams newness to this option of eating. But please do visit, it's well worth it.

title: Very happy to have stumbled across this place.
comment: This saturday just gone, myself and a few friends were out and just happened to pass this place. I'm very happy with did. It's decked out really well, probably recently refurbished or something, the roof top bar was a lovely surprise and the bar staff were very friendly and willing to have a chat. If you are in the area, be sure to pop in. The only reason I wouldn't give it a full rating is the drinks were a little pricey.

title: ridiculous Sunday Roast
comment: I went to this place with 14 friends,so we decided to order the prime rib of beef for 3\4 people,we ordered 2 of those,the size was different,the reason of the difference they said was because on portion was for 3 end the other portion was for 4 but for the same price(75 pound) vegetables were very poor ( just potato and caponata) also it's the first time i see the Sunday roast served with Sicilian caponata!! I tried to order a starter but it arrived with main course, very poor service,12,5% SERVICE CHARGE ON TOP our bill is definitely money stealing to as ,IN THE END during the payment I asked to the waiter to show me the receipt just to check the amount already paid but the waitress said no you cannot check your balance so I spoke with manager which showed me the remaining balance to pay.We are totally unsatisfied of the service and the quality of food .We will never go back to this place.

title: Love The Culpeper
comment: What an amazing place. There is a pub on the ground floor selling pub food. A more luxurious restaurant on the first floor, where the menu changes weekly. Bedrooms on the third floor and a roof garden at the top. We went to the rooftop. There are fresh vegetables growing all around you. There is a bbq type grill and all the food is fresh. The staff were friendly and the service was good. A lovely atmosphere and delicious food at a reasonable price. What more could you want!

title: Exceeding Expectations...
comment: Booked a table last Saturday night in the first floor "Kitchen" after reading various positive reviews. Was our first time here. We prefer more casual restaurants and loved this place. The French food was excellent - we shared mozzarella starter, monkfish wellington and Paris Brest dessert. The people there were attentive and genuinely passionate about their food. It shone through and made for a truly enjoyable evening.

title: Fantastic - go there!
comment: Came across this place by accident while staying in a nearby hotel. The first floor dining room is bright and welcoming and the fresh peach and basil Bellini went down well. Great bread with salty anchovy butter was served quickly. The menu changes every day. The snail, wild garlic and smoked bacon pastry was delicious. The roast lamb rump was outdone by its accompanying petit pois a la Francais - best I've ever had. The French waitress gently steered me towards a carafe of an obscure Organic red wine from Veneto - and I was so pleased she did, as it was superb. Highly recommended.

title: Super food and grat atmosphere!
comment: Decor is amazing, restaurant food is great and really diverse bar is super cool and has a good atmosphere! Perfect for dinner and drinks!

title: Great pub!
comment: Culpeper is a really nice place to hang out with friends! Great place and very friendly atmosphere. And the house wine is surprisingly very good. I only had snacks there, they were quite tasty.

title: Do not visit if you are hungry
comment: Very disappointed with the portions, considering the cost was so high (£16 for a TERRIBLE ROAST) you would think you wouldn't leave feeling hungry. But we did.  If you're looking for over priced bad food in a dreadful East london haunt, the do go but I'd recommend heading to leon for a salad & then any good boozers in the area (which there are plenty) and save yourself the bother!

title: Fantastic Friday afternoon long lunch!
comment: I've been to the Culpeper a few times now as it is a short walk from my office but this is the first time that I have been for lunch. I went with a big group of colleagues, about 10 of us, we had phoned and ordered ahead so that we could have a late lunch at 2.30 and the service and food were great. I already knew that it was a good space that had been lovingly restored in a distressed bare brick style but the food was a good surprise - freshly prepared, an interesting selection of dishes - I liked the pork pie, duck salad and the fish and chips - plus some awesome desserts: Eton Mess and the Panna Cotta are my top tips (the cookies that come with the Panna Cotta are incredible - I could have eaten just a plate of them!). Combine this with a good wine list meant that lunch finished at about 7.30pm - and I left some people still going!

title: Trendy
comment: I use the term "trendy" in the good sense and in the bad sense. This place is at the extreme end of gastropubbery as the food is cleverly prepared, well presented and very tasty. The wine list is interesting (beware the cloudy, unfiltered "Pinot Grigio" that isn't really like the Pinot Grigio that ever other establishment serves) and the prices seem reasonable and the craft beers are "on trend" with some interesting flavours. The refurbishment is tasteful and the place has an open and airy feel and a pleasant buz and the staff were all friendly, efficient and clearly enjoying themselves. However... I do think they are just a little bit "trendy" (in the not-so-good sense) in that they seem to have lost sight of the fact that in order to survive they are going to have to give customers what they want rather than what they would like to serve. Offering Sunday lunch without a beef option (other than a £75 for 3-4 people) is probably not going to work in the long term in my opinion. So, this place deserves to succeed and I really hope they do as they are clearly passionate about what they do. We will try the more formal restaurant on the first floor some time an look forward to the roof terrace opening in June.

title: Boozy lunch with the boss
comment: Ended up here as there were no pool tables available in the other pubs we visited. This doesn't have pool tables either but we'd given up by this time and decided to just have some drinks. We were served straight away and although we weren't eating, we were shown to a table in the dining area anyway. While there we decided to have some food and we both opted for the sandwich of the day - egg mayo, with chips. These arrived in good time and were just right - not too big and heavy and with proper chips, not fries. My white wine spritzers were lovely too! We're having a department lunch in a few weeks so I've booked the rooftop for this. I have clicked "not good for families with children" because I wouldn't want them in there. I don't actually know if they cater for families with children. I also don't know if it was good value for money because my boss paid!

title: Beef was sublime
comment: Went to the Culpeper last night with a group of work friends and had a really good time. The Beef with the sautee potatoes was absolutely amazing and great for sharing. Atmosphere was really nice and staff were very helpful. The only reason this is not a 5 is because had a bottle of Red there that didnt smell or taste very nice and it was recommended by the staff. Apart form that it was faultless, great night and would go again.

title: Friendly Pub with a nice buzz
comment: Went here with my wife and son to kill an hour before moving on to a nearby restaurant. It was a Saturday night early so it was busy but not manic. Nice friendly staff and not over priced. First impressions were very positive and I will surely come back to eat as the menu looked very interesting and reasonably priced. I should add that the toilets which are upstairs are very clean and modern as this is often a fair indicator of how an establishment like this is run and maintained.

title: Lovely after curry couple of pints
comment: We went to the pub after a curry on brick lane. Totally hipster with the wooden chairs from school the distressed brick walls and cracked plaster. However the beer was great service good and good atmosphere will be back

title: Amazing roof garden in the middle of London
comment: We had a lovely time. Fresh menu with vegs straight from their garden, all cooked from the terrace. Excellent service. I highly recommend!

title: Friendly welcome
comment: Great for drinks. friendly staff. Though much inconstancy with the food menu, no-one sure what was available.

title: disappointing
comment: We read the reviews on TA & Jay Rayner & chose to go for Sat lunch. Staff were very cheerful & accommodating but unfortunately disorganised. Food mix ups due to wrong table receiving wrong food resulted in half our party getting lunch way before before the rest of us so they had almost finished by the time we got ours. No apology offered. Menu very limited on Sat lunch with a choice of only 2 puds. Portions on the fish & chips were small. Lovely pub with good atmosphere but all in all disappointing.

title: Brilliant environment
comment: Culpeper has a nice atmosphere, good music and cute furniture.  I just took a glass of wine and the quality was pretty good. I will try asap their brunchs.

title: Slightly disappointing
comment: Having read a number of very positive reviews of this converted old east end pub I was keen to try the menu.I used this Pub in the 90,s when it had a thriving darts team so it was a pleasant surprise to see how tastefully the old interior had been changed.There are plenty of windows so people outside can see the mass of people inside enjoying themselves.We decided to have a bottle of wine downstairs before eating on the first floor.I was surprised to find a number of fruit flies trying to dive into my wine which really is a no no.We skipped starters and had a main and a dessert.The bread with Anchovy butter was lovely,crunchy and tangy.My piece of lamb was perfectly cooked and the broccoli with salsa verde was the star of the show.Beautifully cooked,crunchy with a great taste from the mint in the verde.However,the lamb was a small portion of a cheap cut and for the price of £15 I would have liked and expected a bit more on my plate.Perhaps I am out of sync with the modern trend? I chose the 3 pieces of cheese for my dessert and was very disappointed.The blue cheese was nice and creamy with a sharp taste but the others tasted as if they had been standing out for far too long as they were sweaty and a bit dry.The accompanying chutney was delicious.3 Small pieces of cheese for £10 is I think over priced.I had cheese at Iberica the other week which knocked spots off this.The sea bass at £20 looked good as did the rhubarb eaten by my friend who enjoyed both..The red wine at £20 a bottle,Gassac Rouge was good value.So overall I think the food is skillfully prepared,well presented in a pleasant setting but in my view over priced.

title: Good pub grub at fine dining prices
comment: having tried this pub for drinking ( very good) we thought we would book for dinner. the reservations seem disorganised in that they say they are fully booked at times they are not and then take walk ins. service well meaning but amateurish. main course of monk fish Wellington for two was wonderful but the trendy purple potatoes unimaginatively boiled and very dry. several diners commented on the potatoes but staff didn't seem bothered. Competition is on the increase in this area and this place will need to up its game or revise prices if they are to attract repeat local business

title: Tasty food
comment: I was impressed with the food at Culpeper. I had the Jacob's ladder as main and the rhubarb dessert. They were both delicious. The atmosphere in the restaurant is quite nice. It's a small, quiet area very different from the loud pub downstairs. The food is not cheap but I think it is definitely worth a try. I would visit again in the summer when the rooftop garden is open.

title: Pleasantly surprised
comment: Found this place while wandering about East London on a lovely sunny day. Outside, men in suits were quaffing their pints whilst inside is a large, impressive bar area with plenty of tables, most of them occupied. Luckily there was room at the stools looking out over Commercial Rd. Menus were brought swiftly by happy, smiley staff. Lunch menu small but that didn't bother us - don't like to have to wade through pages of dishes. Settled for some sharing plates; a very flavoursome portion of potted shrimps on toast, mussels and bacon in cider, marrowbones, a bowl of deliciously crunchy chips and some home made bread with anchovy butter. Glass of unfiltered white wine looked odd being so cloudy but looks were deceptive as it was very very good. My (adult) son had a beer from a pretty large selection. Looking forward to a return visit to have dinner in the upstairs dining room, probably in the summer when the roof garden is open.

title: A fabulous meal, beautifully served!
comment: This is beautifully renovated pub/ restaurant. Fantastic food, great service and relaxed ambiance - a delightful surprise - highly recommended!

title: Fabulous New Years Eve
comment: What a lovely friendly pub and had such a good New Years Eve ever. The duck meal was lovely and we would like to thank all the staff there that made our night so much fun. Great prices and a hidden gem in the depths of Commercial Road.

title: disappointingly no more than an average pub food
comment: it's better to only have 4 main course on offer and to do it well rather than a lot of choices and failing to deliver because of a complicated menu. Unfortunately, this pub does only 4 choices for main and does not even do it well. I had the Sunday roast pork and I did not enjoy it. The slices of roast pork were not cut properly, i ended up with pieces of fat and very little meat. The gravy had the consistency of water. I was offered the dessert menu but by the time I had finished my main, I had lost confidence in this business. I asked for the bill and got dessert somewhere else

title: Best meal and service I've had in East London in a while...
comment: The staff are amazing - so helpful. We didn't have a booking and the restaurant was full. After a drink at the bar a table become available and we were given the table. Food was amazing. The homemade bread and anchovy butter is so so good! The cauliflour soup was amazing and should definately be tried! Best roast I've had in London. (Maybe joint with People on the Park Tavern, Victoria Park). The atmosphere is amazing. Perfect for date / chilling with friends and family. The desserts sounded incredible but I was too full for one. Nothing is too much for the staff... I like to ask lots of questions and they are passionate about food and drink so was never a problem :-) loveee love love thankssss

title: A great find.
comment: A good lunch today with friendly, efficient service. Risotto was excellent and a good choice on the menu. Good value.

title: Lovely service and tasty food.
comment: We booked a table at the Culpeper for lunch/brunch one Saturday afternoon and were really pleasantly suprised. The staff were lovely and looked after us really well - our server was particularly chatty and even knew the history behind the unique name of the place.  My only point would be the menu - it wasn't huge (which is fine) but because it wasn't specifically a lunch or brunch menu there wasnt a huge amount to choose from if you'd decided to have one of the others.  We were all after brunch food, which meant we had a lot less to choose from - so all ended up having a cooked breakfast (which wasn't really what everyone wanted).  However the food was of a great quality and cooked really well. And I know baked beans aren't exactly fancy, but they were missed from the breakfasts!  Oh also, the cocktails were incredible. The Florodora was just... amazing!

title: Amazing food, great service, beautiful old boozer
comment: Thank you to all at the Culpeper - we had an amazing meal last night. The food is incredible, and great value for such well-thought out, well-cooked dishes. Can especially recommend the deep-fried pigs head and the lamb stew. Mmmmm. The staff are really friendly, the atmosphere is fantastic, and all in all a great place for a meal with good friends.

title: Very nice place and good beer
comment: verry nice place with. Boring beer on tap, but good microbrewed beer om bottles. Didn`t try the Food but it looked very nice

title: Fabulous food and service
comment: We went back to the Culpeper to see the recent changes to the building and my what a change. Lovely restaurant area upstairs and a really great welcome from the team who recognized us from NYE. Now that's great customer service!  Our food was again fabulous and the waiter was brilliant. We didn't get his name but very talented with the choice of wine and very passionate. He recommended a great wine which was amazing and still makes my mouth water remembering it. Great find in a busy commercial road and worth every penny for two of us , a three course meal and a decent bottle of wine was just £120.  We would come back just for the great hospitality here but the food and wine is amazing too so win win for us! Thanks for a great night.

title: Really good Sunday roast in a bright and nice environment
comment: If you plan to spend your Sunday at Spitalfields Market, this is definitely a good spot for having lunch. The Sunday roast (constantly updated) is really tasty and well presented, especially the garnish. We appreciated the bright and open concept of this gastropub, we'll sure come back when visiting London.

title: Nice but not as nice as previously?
comment: A friend was keen to return as she'd loved it 6 months or so ago, however since then the drinks options have changed and we weren't that impressed by the sugary insipid grapefruit gin cocktail we had or the refusal of the waiter to create a requested drink off the menu despite all the ingredients being available at the bar. The food was nice but small portions so poor value. I like the decor and atmosphere but its a bit drafty and the disappointment on the food and drink front drove us elsewhere for the evening.

title: now with a new restaurant
comment: Ate here just after they opened, now they have a restaurant on the first floor. The food is much better than anything I have previously eaten in a pub, and the quality of the cooking is up there with some of the best restaurants. Mains of monk fish and lamb were tasty and full of flavour. The jus served with the lamb was rich and meaty and the shrimp sauce with the monk fish was delicious. Desserts were divine. Menu changes daily, which is great. Will definitely be returning (oh and some excellent beers too

title: Gorgeous roast dinner and pub
comment: We had a Sunday lunch there today and it was so tasty. We booked in advance and there weren't many unreserved tables left. It was £16 each which we thought was reasonable and it was well worth it. They are very generous portions and I couldn't decide what to leave when I was full as it was all so nice. The staff are fantastic and welcoming. The pub itself is very nice and clean. We can't wait to come again thank you

title: Best fish & chips ever
comment: Called in for lunch at 1.30 pm on a Thursday and it was very busy with lots of people eating and drinking. I ordered fish and chips at £11 which turned out to be the best I'd ever had. The chips were perfect and the fish really fresh. There was something in the mushy peas that made them very special. I followed the meal with a very nice latte, by which time the place had emptied out and was quiet and relaxing. There's obviously a lot of renovation working being carried out which gives the place a somewhat unfinished look, but if quality of food and service is what you're after, then you won't be disappointed. I'd really like to return one evening for a meal in the restaruant upstairs.

title: fush and chups
comment: I had previously visited the same venue when it was previously the Princess Alice.....what an incredible transformation! Not only was I highly impressed with the décor and atmosphere but the cocktails, food and service were great as well. I am really surprised to read other reviews which were negative about the fish and chips. I ordered it and would put it down as one of the best I've had in recent memory! Overall I would highly recommend.

title: Best Roast I've had in London
comment: So I live in the area and read a few of the reviews of The Culpeper prior to visiting and was preparing myself for it to be average (previous reviewers had said it was bland, dry and portions were small for the price etc.) I would disagree 100%. We went there with a group of 8, they brought the roast out platter style which not only looked fantastic but made the whole experience a whole lot more fun. The portions were NOT small. We had at least a whole chicken left over after we'd all stuffed ourselves stupid. The food was fantastic. Absolutely fantastic. I've been underwhelmed by a lot of supposedly fantastic roasts in London and this was nothing short of exceptional. I didn't have one of the bloody marys but everyone on the table said they were great. No one spent over £25 (we were drinking also) either to those who said it wasn't good value for money - I disagree.  We had the table for well over two hours and weren't shuffled out by staff which is always refreshing for a Sunday roast in London. Would highly recommend you try The Culpeper on Sunday.

title: Sunday roast
comment: Great venue Great food  AMAZING drinks and great staff! Thank you Antonio for taking me to your place,it was a pleasant surprise.

title: Great Sunday lunch
comment: Went for Sunday lunch and was pleasantly surprised: lots of food and great flavour and very reasonable price. Nice atmosphere, not TOO trendy - look forward to the garden being open - maybe soon?

title: Amazing sunday roast
comment: So I came to the culpeper last Sunday with a group of 5 friends for Sunday roast and I was really positively impressed. I had the braised lamb with old fashion traditional dumplings and it was just great, super tasty, juicy, real comfort food. My friends had the roast chicken, it was served in a huge platter, family stile enough to feed an army. By the end of the roast we were so stuffed we couldn't even try to eat dessert. Cocktails were absolutely fantastic. We asked the barman Max, to make us some digestive for after the meal and he presented us with the best negronis we ever had, simply AMAZING!  Over all it was a great experience, and we didn't even paid that much, total of 25£ per person, with at least 2 cocktails each!  Highly recommend!

title: Great for a drink near spitalfields
comment: Went here after wandering around market - relaxed not too loud - nice beers and wine - didn't eat the food but it smelt good! Recommend

title: Very good roast!
comment: Went here today for Sunday lunch - they select one type of meat for roast, so you don't know what you'll get until you go. When I saw it was chicken, I admit I was slightly disappointed but when it came, those doubts went. For starter we chose the pigs head croquettes (pictured) which came with a kohlrabi salad - these were very tasty. For main, we both selected the roast chicken which came with roast potatoes, glazed carrots, Yorkshire pudding, and red cabbage. A jug of chicken gravy and a pot of bread sauce accompanied it. Now, it sounds like a normal roast, but the quality here is key. Everything was very rich, tasty, and filling. We had a pint of Meantime Yakima each alongside, and were too full to contemplate dessert.  For a roast dinner it was one of the best I've had - but I'm sure you would get more inventive food if you decided to go on a weekday. Bill came to £27 each including tip, so not that bad at all.

title: Nice pub and good food
comment: I have spent a lovely night with a group of friends: noice athmosphere, good food and quite good choice of wines and cocktails. not the cheepest place in the area, but it worths a visit!

title: Food average, prices not so
comment: Visited for roast. The beer and wine were very good but food not so. I would normally choose roast beef but the only beef on the menu was £75 for a joint to share between 3 or 4 - not an option when just with my vegetarian girlfriend, so had no choice but to have pork. Which is fine but would rather have some choice. Complimentary bread with anchovy butter was an excellent free appetiser. My girlfriend obviously ordered the vegetarian roast, which when came was not a roast at all. Instead, it was a plate of new potatoes and burnt kale. She enjoyed the new potatoes but it wasn't what she was hoping for. See @ellaflo_xo for 4 tweet rant. My roast pork was fine - meat tender, roast potatoes crispy, Yorkshire pudding homemade, cauliflower cheese creamy but portions small and no other veg.  Overall, it was an average meal for above average price. Nice decor in the pub and decent service but for the price I'd expect more. Won't be going back.

title: City v Hipster
comment: Just on the fringes of the Eastern end of the City revamped pub showing good skiils in the kitchen. Pork Scratching popcorn is a winner. You don't need a beard to be welcomed, but it might help....

title: Rude staff who keep making you move tables
comment: After spending some time here we were moved from our table by rude staff who said it was reserved. Nobody came to the table, its just a ploy to make the bar area look busy. This bar had great promise, sadly the attitude of staff has ruined that, there are plenty of better pubs in the area

title: All looks but no substance with rude and poorly trained staff
comment: I booked a table at the Culpeper because of reviews online and because I needed somewhere close to home, it was for a birthday party. The menu just looked really unexciting and everyone on the table (5) ordered the same dish...the other dishes just didn't speak at all...so fish and chips it was...well and that was disappointing..it was like eating a bag of crisps...the fish was just not appetising and the portions were small, it was like the fish was battered yesterday and heated up in the microwave the service was sketchy, we stayed on for drinks and then one of the bar staff was just so rude (the baldy one)..the whole place just reeks of 'look how trendy we are'...I've lived in that area for over 10 years and seen all this happening time and time again, the decor looks amazing but the rest is just a damp squib...

title: Nice trendy bar/restaurant
comment: Nice trendy bar/restaurant, have been a few times recently but only ever for drinks. Gets very busy (on a Friday evening any way). Haven't tried the food there yet but looks great.

title: Average good, small portions
comment: Very disappointing. Bills itself as a gastropub but it's one of those gastropubs that charges restaurant prices for mediocre food and small portions... in other words, the worst kind of pub. Went for Sunday lunch and ordered a roast chicken because it's the only roast they have - they pride themselves in doing only one roast each Sunday. But when the single roast is mediocre, the concept is laughable. This roast dish consist of one small chicken leg, a bit of red cabbage, a small Yorkshire (best part of the dish) and a good portion of roast potatoes. A couple of big problems with this dish 1) the chicken portion is tiny and is dwarfed by everything else on the plate - when the dish is called "roast chicken", one expects there to be a fair bit of chicken! 2) the chicken is just ok. The skin is not crispy but rather just dry. The meat is fairly juicy but not juicy enough.  the roast potatoes are a bit dry - I've had far better at other pubs. The final disappointment of this dish is it cost £16. In order to get full, you have to order a starter and maybe a "nibble". Oh, and you can order a side of greens (where it is normally included in other Sunday lunches). We ordered "pork popcorn" and out came a measly portion of popcorn with a hint of pork scratching (needs more than a hint to make it worth the small portion that it is.- frankly, popcorn is not something to be measly about (it was less than a handful - and I have small hands).  An order of a "large" glass of wine is really a small in my book.  To sum up, when you are a pub serving Sunday lunch, you can't charge £16 for a plate of roast chicken that leaves diners hungry after consuming the whole plate. That's just a crime.

title: Cool place!
comment: I enjoyed a lot my drinks and the brownie with salted caramel!! I liked a lot the atmosphere, the decoration and the location! For dessert and drinks highly recommended. Haven't tried rest of the menu.

title: Good roast, shame about the inconsistent serving size.
comment: We ate there this afternoon having heard quite good things on this site.  The starters were quite tasty, but simple and small. Our pork roast (they currently rotate the meats from week to week) meal was also quite tasty, however both my girlfriend and I both remarked that it was a bit too small (mainly the pork) and was seriously lacking some veg servings (veg was red cabbage and potatoes only, surely veg is the cheapest part of the meal - and what is a roast without some veg options?)... We assumed this was how they come, and as we aren't in the habit of complaining unless it's something more pressing we didn't let it bother us.  However, I was soon displeased when the table next to us had their pork roasts brought to them, containing noticeably larger portions of pork, and with each an additional extra-large potato. At the risk of sounding like a potato-counter, their meal was perhaps a third bigger than ours. A sunday pork-roast is my favourite meal of the week, so I was not impressed...However I didn't find an appropriate time or way to mention it without causing a scene (or coming across as a moany git). On this experience I probably won't go there again, which is a shame as the service was fair and the decor is quite interesting.

title: lovely lunch!
comment: I had lunch with my son here on 29th October. We both had fish and chips with squashed peas and rye bread with anchovy butter. The meal was lovely and cooked to perfection,I was a little sceptical about the anchovy butter,but it really complimented the rye bread. The waiter was very welcoming and I felt really comfortable. I would definitely dine here again when I visit my son again in London! Incidentally, my son dines here regularly and says the Sunday Lunch is superb!!!

title: Great sunday roast
comment: The place is airy and the staff is really friendly, you do like the wine list. The sunday roast is great, but some of starters have too much going on the plate, overall you should really go there, maybe try the duck

title: Local pub with a difference
comment: A great atmosphere, friendly & accommodating staff, fantastic and original cocktail menu full of interesting drinks and some great twists on the classics. The food and service are great too. Love the décor (big windows, plants everywhere, exposed brick, interesting without being pretentious). Good place to meet friends & catch up over a local beer or a refreshingly unusual cocktail.

title: City Vibes
comment: Conversion ongoing in this huge old house in the City, a bit weird and wonderful [used to be a brothel!] must go up on the roof to see the view. Inside busy, buzzing and mixtures of different food e.g. [popcorn with pork scratchings]. Service friendly and helpful but a bit overwhelmed? Good beer & wine selections. Go, I feel sure this place will become really hot!

title: Uber cool spot
comment: Noticed that this pub, which has also been a brothel and darts room evidently, had re-opened about 3 months ago and tried it out at breakfast, which is all very laid-back and friendly. Loved the roof-top herb garden which supplied the ingredients for the top notch food and where you can have picnics, complete with blankets after the sun goes down behind The Gherkin. Excellent roasts on Sunday with yummy yorkshire puddings. Great interior and although light and airy it does give some of the history a chance to shine through - you can book tables for groups. I understand that there is a restaurant opening soon on the first floor, so a return visit needs to be made for sure.

title: Amazing food and in relaxed setting with really great staff
comment: We ate at The Culpeper on a Wednesday night for dinner. The location is ideal and the interior of the restaurant is incredible, it has a really nice layed back atmosphere even though they were packed with customers. The layout means that you can come in just for a drink, or for a meal, and both drinks and food menus are amazing. The drinks menu is really different with lots of delicious cocktails with herbs and the food was genuinley amazing!  We eat out quite alot in London and like really good food but hate stuffy atmospheres - so this place was perfect. To nibble on at first we had the Porkcorn (marriage made in heaven of pork scratchings blended and mixed in with salt popcorn) and then to start I had a really fresh but flavoursome poached troat and beetroot salad. For main I had the pork which I would not normally choose in a restaurant but I knew it was going to be perfectly cooked. It was really delicious and the portions sizes were generous but not overwhelmingly so - totally ideal. Service was great, the staff were really friendly and laid back and we will definitely be returning. One of the best places in London which I have eaten at.

title: A lot of character
comment: Staff is extremly helpful and flexible, managed to accomodate us on the fantastic roof top although we did not book in advance.  Food is presented in a very nice way and tastes really delicious. Roof top is also the kitchen's herbal garden which gives everything a nice touch.

title: Great Pub/Restaurant
comment: Only opened in the last year, this place has a great range of real beers and serves delicious and reasonably priced food. The setting is really pleasant and the staff service is first class.

title: nice pub but no snacks available
comment: Popped in for a quick pint and a snack but there weren't any which was a shame! Nicely refurbished pub.

title: Good pub dinner
comment: Read some excellent reviews of this newish place, so while in London had a look, for an evening meal. Weather not great so stayed inside as opposed to roof top garden. Liked the atmosphere in the bar. All in all good place. Service was a bit disjointed and slow but think they are still learning. Food very good value and not a huge menu which is always a good sign I think. Everything made fresh. Would go back again.

title: Great twist on Sunday Roast and local beer selection
comment: I had heard about the new restaurant so was keen to give it a try.  I came to the Culpepper twice during a visit to London and the first was just for a quick beer where the staff greeted us and had a good little conversation about the place as it had just recently opened.  The next day we went back for the Sunday roast which was served with Kale as the veggies on the side. The pork was succulent and the Yorkshires were amazing. The food wasn't greasy at all and you could tell fresh ingredients were used. The staff member from behind the bar remembered us from the day before and the servers were very friendly. I would recommend a visit just to check the place out as it has some kitsch decor and the selection of beers from London itself was a nice touch.

title: Go here immediately!
comment: I stayed above the Culpeper for a week and was excited to try the food but didn't have much expectation. It was AMAZING! I tried pretty much everything on the menu. Chef Sandy is wonderful! He has taken traditional English food and given it such exquisite uniqueness and taste. Not only can you try new things but if you fancy a pie, or just chips you are in luck because they are both some of the best you will ever have. The bar staff is knowledgeable, friendly, and attractive so really what more could you want! The cocktails were both familiar but with a unique twist. Great wine list, wonderful beer both on tap and in the bottle. Their rooftop urban farm provides fresher than fresh vegetables and herbs for the menu, which in my mind is always a plus. And finally, what really topped it off for me is that you got all of this without being pretentious. So whether you are new to the foodie scene or an avid eater and drinker such as myself you can get the exact experience you are looking for. Enjoy!

title: Great place for brunch as well as Happy Hour
comment: We went for Sunday brunch and everything was delicious. Staff is very friendly, and save room for the Brownie dessert.

title:
they need to sort lunchtime service ..
staff lack leadership
comment: I've been here a few times so the food is good. Was disappointed today - lunchtime with the service to order at the bar. It needs sorting out.. leadership is lacking and management skills..

title: Great food and excellent Beer
comment: I have eaten here a couple of times. Fish and chips are fresh and very tasty (£10) and oysters were fresh and a bargain during the happy hour (2 for 1); although I would prefer then to be served on ice rather than salt. The bread served with the meal is fresh and delicious served with anchovy butter. The atmosphere in the pub is fairly laid back and relaxed and the interior is very light and airy. The beers I've tried are also excellent. Great place for lunch - i will go back and try out the Sunday Roast.

title: Amazing Food, Airy & Light with Warm Staff
comment: I visited this pub on a warm Tuesday and from entering this light and airy pub I knew I would be returning. We started with the freshest olives and made in house herbaceous crisps. I had the homemade juice, which was simply delightful, very refreshing with a touch of ginger.  We opted for the picnic on the rooftop and I'm so glad we did. The green jungle hidden upstairs was a green treat! The welcome chase gin and tonic was a happy addition to the boxed delights of bacon cous cous, bread with anchovy butter and the most moresome duck rillet with pork pie and cauliflower. To finish the most scrumptious brownie with creme faiche, all for £15. Can't wait to return and try the menu downstairs.

title: very poor service
comment: We came to the Culpeper on a Sunday as a group of five people celebrating the birthdays of a couple of our friends.  There were several problems that made this a really disappointing experience, which was a real shame as we had heard good things and we were really looking forward to going.  We had booked as a table of five and were clearly squeezed in on a much smaller table. That was after waiting 15 minutes to be seated. When we were eventually sat down, it took a further 15 minutes before we had to ask for menus.  It took well over an hour for our food to come out, it came out cold and it took a further ten minutes for them to provide us with gravy to go with our roast dinner. After already waiting an hour this was incredibly frustrating. As a table of five celebrating I felt that we were there for the overall experience as much as for the food, but this was totally ruined for us. There was no real sincere apology and no real service; we may as well have served ourselves.  The worst part was the woman working at the front, whose job title I can only assume is ‘mindless wanderer’. She seemed completely oblivious to the situation and showed no real urgency to any of our requests. It was such a shame as we were expecting so much more. I can’t imagine we will go again or recommend this place to any of our friends.

title: Complacency Rules
comment: Came in here for food and drink and it was promising. Took quite a while to get served as one barman was busy washing glasses, another was collecting glasses and delivering to the washer!!! Guys, your job is to sell beer and food not cleaners!!! Tidy is good but service is better. They were not that busy but I see a good bar undermined by complaceny that they are doing alright. The manager of the bar needs a rocket!! The beer was excellent but when I asked for beer list ............!!! All their fonts are engraved with invisible wording!!! Good beer but I decided not to eat here due to the service ethic!!!

title: Good Sunday lunch
comment: Handy for a Sunday lunch after going round the markets and Spitalfields.Ambience is a little on the spit n' sawdust side but seems to work well.Reasonably priced for the City.  Menu can seem to be a bit restricted, but the food is good!

title: Another great night
comment: What an amazing place this is and never disappoints me! Fabulous atmosphere and drinks and really great staff who are really friendly and helpful. Always makes me smile coming here for a drink or dinner! Keep up the great work guys!

title: Unexpectedly good cocktails
comment: Having visited a couple times due to the lovely interior, atmosphere and pleasant staff it is definitely somewhere I shall often frequent. The pub feels intimate and relaxed as well as being a trendier spot.  I would highly recommend the roof terrace which feels like you are in someone's garden it's very quaint!  This weekend I had their winter julep cocktail a warm cocktail served in a tea pot, a lovely surprise!  Will be back very soon!
